Reviews.Title: “A bit dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Natalia1150
Reviews.Content: I had late arrival to Istanbul and ordered pik-up service. I was met by a professional driver, he was very helpful with my luggage and while we were on our way to the hotel, he told me a lot about Istanbul and its sightseeings. In the hotel I was provided twin room for single use. The room is small though there are all necessary amenities, except of gel shower:) Or maybe I didn't find it. In the morning I had to wait for a place in the restaurant as it was full. Breakfast wasn't varied and also it was almost empty as like I mentioned before restaurant was full of people. I choose this hotel because of its reviews on TripAdvisor and in general I was a bit dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Kiong Li L
Reviews.Content: The trip was an eye opener for me as didn't know Istanbul has so much history. If one were to throw a stone in any direction in Istanbul, it will hit a spot with a history to tell. Looking at the heritage building and noticed that the architect and engineer those days can do a much better job than present construction industry, considering the primitive engineering tool available back then. Food is great and souvenir aplenty. Moving around in tram is very convenient in Istanbul Were definitely come back soon and will travel outside Istanbul to explore. Front office manager Sinan Oktem in Romance Hotel is very helpful with the local information. He is very passionate about Turkey culture and willing to share his knowledge. I was informed by him that Mevlevi Sema is not a dance but a mystic ritual performed during ceremony. Room condition need to be improved. Will give him 5 star for his service.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle free”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaConniegirl
Reviews.Content: We all know arriving at accommodation can be a chore. Transfer, traffic, stress, etcs. No need to worry. This was my 3rd stay the Romance and I always leave feeling I am saying goodbye to my international family. We were collected at the airport by a professional clean staff member, transferred without fear, greeted with open arms and were provided all the necessary accommodation needs. The rooms are clean, the location is the best and the staff are always courteous and friendly. Breakfast is plentiful and it is a great setting to meet other happy travellers. Don't hesitate, I'm sure you will have the same experience

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Cath P
Reviews.Content: This was my third visit to Istanbul and my third stay at the Romance Hotel in the past 5 years. This time I stayed for 6 nights and I had absolutely no complaints. This is such a nice hotel, I always feel welcomed and safe and of course the location is perfect. The staff, many I have met previously, I now consider friends and am always pleased to see them. They are friendly and helpful and always willing to assist when needed. The front office staff led by Sinan organised my transfer to and from the airport, greeted me like an old friend on arrival and ensured my stay was enjoyable.The housekeeping staff are very efficient and my room was always at an excellent standard. Breakfast was always plentiful and provided some choice and again the staff were terrific. Of an evening my friends would gather in the bar prior to venturing out for dinner and the bar staff were always courteous and friendly and willing to have a chat and a laugh. I would recommend the Romance to anyone who wants an affordable comfortable place to stay in the heart of old Istanbul. I travel quite a lot and am a firm believer in 'it is not always about the places you see but more about the people you meet' and the staff at the Romance Hotel ensure that my visit to Istanbul is a happy and enjoyable experience. Thank you all.

Reviews.Title: “Just back and loved it”
Reviews.Author: VivienMinto
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a three night stay in Istanbul, staying at the Romance Hotel. We found them to be helpfulness itself - they replaced the hairdryer in our room as soon as we asked, brought extra pillows without being chased for them, and produced an umbrella in the rain! My only slight grumble was arriving to breakfast at 9.40 (it finishes at 10) to find no table for us, and the breakfast was rather pastry-heavy, not entirely our choice. I think, though we didn't do it, that it would be possible to ask them to boil an egg, or produce something more to our taste - I'm sure they would happily do so... and being Easter weekend, the hotel was probably full hence the busy breakfast room. Without question, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect (budget) hotel to visit Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Taziro
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at Romance Hotel a few days in Easter 2012. Booking at the hotel webpage, we have paid 99 euros per night, breakfast included. Given Istanbul's hotel prices at peak season, we think that it is a reasonable price. This is the second time we have chosen this hotel to visit Istanbul. The main reason is that its location is just perfect: Sutanahmet Square (where Santa Sofia and the Blue Mosque are located) and the Egiptian Market are just at a few minutes walk. In addition, there is a tram stop at a few metres (which is quite useful, among other reasons, to go to the airport) and Eminonu piers (from which boats for the Asian neighbourhoods of Istanbul and for the Golden Horn leave) are very close. Both rooms and common areas of the hotel are very clean. Breakfast (taking into consideration the price paid) is very good: good quality and a large enough range of products. One of the best things of the hotel is that the staff (both at the reception and the restaurant) is extremely nice and helpful. My wife and I travel a lot all over the world and we have met a lot of nice people at other hotels, but Romance Hotel's employees' are just second to none. On the negative side, I would say that some rooms are a bit small and could be noisy (because of the tram that passes by). Indeed, the first room that we got was like this; but the staff at the reception changed us the day after, as soon as they got a free room. The new room was perfect: large enough, with a balcony and king size bed.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Abu Dhabi, Abu Dhabi, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and everything else”
Reviews.Author: GMAKFAR
Reviews.Content: I am a very experienced global traveler for both business and personal trips and would highly recommend the Romance Hotel. My wife, son and I spent 5 days in Istanbul with the Romance as our base and it was great. The staff is very friendly and helpful, especially Sinan Ã–ktem, the front office manager. Location can't be beat - within less than 10 -15 minutes, you can walk to Topkapi Palace, Hagia Sophia, Blue Mosque, Yerbaten Cistern, Grand Bazaar, Spice/Egyptian Bazaar, Galata Bridge/Eminou with many, many restaurants, cafes, shops all around. The tram line goes right by the hotel so it makes it very easy to get to Beyoglu and further points. The buffet breakfast is excellent so make sure you get a package which includes it. The rooms are fine (lots of room, bathroom good, etc.) and the wireless internet was very good. My cousin and his wife stayed here as well and they also loved it. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A very frendly hotel in the absolute center of the old town”
Reviews.Author: Stig F
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 5 nights. From the first moment we were greeted to a friendly and enthusiastic staff. Very good breakfast with many interesting details. Good beds with a fixed bed. Many channels on TV from many countries.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff”
Reviews.Author: Arline100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - easy walking distance to all of the sights in the old town and close to the tram line. The staff were superb, especially Sinan & Sadik, and provided excellent tips on travelling around, sights to see and restaurants. The rooms are fairly basic but quite spacious and the breakfast buffet is plentiful and varied.

Reviews.Title: “perfect postion / excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Biljana M
Reviews.Content: Hotel location is perfectly accessible to all main tourists sites of old town and near the tram station.The service was excellent, staff are very helpful and friendly, room is very clean and buffet breakfast very good. We had a lovely stay at Romance hotel for five days.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice and well placed hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traian V
Reviews.Content: We have consumed some time searching on the internet a place where to spent a family anniversary. Our big surprise was to find in Romance hotel exactly the place we wanted to be: cozy, peaceful and romantic atmosphere, very kind and helpful staff - particularly Sadik - extremely well placed location for three days to visit Istanbul wanders! The size of the room is not a problem when you stay most of time outside. Traian & Adina from Bucharest, Romania

Reviews.Title: “An excellent base, with service to match”
Reviews.Author: DunblaneChristine
Reviews.Content: The Romance Hotel is wonderfully placed, with all the major points we wished to see in easy walking distance. Our room, though small, was very clean and pleasantly equipped, it was a city centre hotel, and rooms in central London are also small. The staff were all excellent and their service impeccable; their English wonderful. The breakfast buffet was an eye opener and an evening meal in the Olive restaurant a real treat.

Reviews.Title: “perfect position”
Reviews.Author: gillianweatherburn
Reviews.Content: we have just returned after 4 nights here. the hotel is perfectly positioned for all the main sites in the old town. the staff are very helpful and friendly and the amenities as you would expect. Our room 409 was on the small side, but as its a city break not much time is spent in it anyway. we used the sultan spa at the sister hotel, the sultan, which was very nice. I had a hammam, which was as good as i had in morrocco, and in nice surroundings. I also had a massage which was much needed. the breakfast is nice, but fairly standard. Overall impression of istanbul was a fascinating city, but the mass of humanity was at times hard to comprehend. did all the main tourist sites and had a great time

Reviews.Title: “Excellent enviroment & service”
Reviews.Author: KUNMINGENT
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife for four days. It is a quiet, clean & tidy place. We enjoyed the relaxation. The room was well decorated & equipped, bright & comfortable. The service was excellent & goods were delicious

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel Price & Service on a perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Princess_Kc
Reviews.Content: Hotel price is absolutely affordable, staffs are really accommodating, room is clean and well equipped. Hotel location is perfectly accessible to all main tourists sites of Old Town, a 5 mins walking distance to Hagia Sofia, Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern (House of Medusa Sisters) and a 10 mins walk to Grand Bazaar. As a Leisure Travel Consultant, i would greatly offer this property to all my clients for a memorable Istanbul escapade. I would also like to extend my deepest appreciation to Mr. Sinan Oktem for his great assistance with us for giving us an amazing stay in your hotel. Princess Kc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent host, great property!”
Reviews.Author: NataLeto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in March 2012 and absolutely loved the experience. The room was beautifully decorated, appointed, clean, bright and comfortable. Friendly staff and good breakfast. Very good location!

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: Jores S
Reviews.Content: Staffs are very accommodating, especially for Sinan Oktem thank you so much for all your help during our stay. Room is very clean and buffet breakfast is excellent keep up the good work guys. Location is very accessible to Hagia Sofia, Blus Mosque and Basilica Cistern (House of Medusa) itâ€™s only just 10minutes by walking, and itâ€™s on the way to Grand Bazaar as well by 5 to 10 minutes from Hagia Sofia area. You will find it there also, the bus tour which is they called it (Hop off-Hop on bust tour) it takes 2hours and it cost 50Lira each. Restaurant and coffee shops boutique shop are along on that area as well. Bosphorus Cruise (Iminono Area) is like 10-15mins by walk. Hope to be back soon, but not during winter time :) Two thumbs up!!!

Reviews.Title: “A nice weeding day”
Reviews.Author: Allan M
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely stay at Romance hotel for five days. The service was excellent, The breakfast was amazaing .. you dont miss any thing. We were for 5 nights for the cause of our 33 years weeding day. Many thanks to the guys un the receiption Sadic, Akin and overy body who was working during the 24 hours service. Many Thanks and see you again. Best Regards Allan/ Kirsten fra Ã˜sterbro altsÃ¥ 2100 KÃ¸benhavn.

Reviews.Title: “a good central hotel near sultanmahmet”
Reviews.Author: funili1
Reviews.Content: Main advantages :a) very convenient location ,really near Ayasofia and topkapi...Tram station 30 meters from the hotel. b) clean c) very good breakfast and well organised breakfast room. Disadvantages : bathroom needs renovation, restoration and ventilation..although it is quite clean.b) In addition some rooms may be really noisy...(if they are at first floor for exable and they face the main street in front of the hotel , just like ours!) .c) quite thin walls between rooms, some problems with soundproof but not that important. Generally, someone can say that it is a rather good and decent hotel .

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: Sunset71
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Romance hotel for 2 nights and although this does not belong to the group of hotels in the luxury range I must say that I find this a very clean and functional hotel. My room was a good size and comfortable one. Its location is excellent as it literally is at walking distance of the main sights in Istanbul and just around the corner of GÃ¼lhane tram stop. The personal is ready to assist if needed, I asked for a flatter pillow and they promptly came to bring one to me. When I asked for help to open the blocked security box placed in the room they immediately came for assistance. I can say that this is a hotel which stands very well in terms of good value for money, I mean for the price paid you get an overall package including good service and comfort. Sinan at the reception tries his best to support clients in their requests. I recommend this hotel for everyone looking for a place offering cleanliness and comfort but at the same time at a more affordable price than its competitors in the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “SÃ¼per !!”
Reviews.Author: Ignace T
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay in the Romance hotel. We simply love it. Everybody of the staff is super friendly and helpful. Rooms and bathrooms are always clean. Breakfast is super !! Excellent fresh food and waiters with a big smile is everything you need to start your day. Special thanks to frontoffice manager Sinan Ã–ktem and receptionstaff. If you have any kind of question or request, they are always there with friendly good advice. We come back. For sure !!! Romance oteli Ã§ok beÄŸendik. Her ÅŸey iÃ§in Ã§ok teÅŸekkÃ¼rler. geri dÃ¶neriz ! (oda 504)

Reviews.Title: “A lovely Hotel near a lot of places of interests”
Reviews.Author: NoElle221293
Reviews.Content: At this hotel there is neither visually nor qualitatively to criticize something. A real gem! The rooms are lovely, neat , comfortable and heated. The whole hotel is beautifully renovated. In the evening the car-free neighborhood made that we had quiet nights. The breakfast room is glazed with a wonderful and unobstructed panoramic view. Also here it is heated. The breakfast buffet was great! The staff is very pleasant and very helpful and is managed by the competent hotel manager.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: Nadiya T
Reviews.Content: Very good location and price, nice room and tasty breakfast. Internet is free and fast. I will come back to this hotel.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “Great, Affordable Choice!”
Reviews.Author: Jen E
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated next to all the major attractions and is really accommodating. The rooms are a bit small and noisy if your room is on the main street, next to the tram stop, but otherwise this hotel is a great value for your money. The staff was really helpful in choosing restaurants and streets to explore. The breakfast spread was also really delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent city and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Larisa S
Reviews.Content: We spent in Istanbul seven days in January, staying in Romance Hotel, recommended to us by a friend and we don't regret. We were completely satisfied with the accommodation and the price. The room was a bit small but comfortable, clean and quiet. The location of the hotel is excellent, within walking distance to major historic sites. At the same time there is a tram station next to the hotel. The tram can deliver you to practically any part of the city. The staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfasts were perfect and various. The city itself is fabulous and a must. If I had a chance I would like to come back and stay in this very hotel. So I would recommend the hotel to anyone who would like to have a nice rest at reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Value!”
Reviews.Author: DafniJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated on thew tramline very close to Topkapi,, the trains to catch the underground to go across by ferry to Asian side, the Hamman, fabulous restuarants, and the Dervish Show - aboslutely close to everything. Clean and neat with good food and great service. The tariff was really affordable. The staff were really most helpful and polite as are all Turks - what a pleasant people. A really great find.

Reviews.Title: “Nice trip in the historical center of a magnificent city”
Reviews.Author: Heidi B
Reviews.Content: We stayd at the Romance Hotel for 4 days at the beginning of the year. Romance hotel is a verry nice hotel. It has a verry good location, in the historical center of the city where you can go sightseeing on foot. The people who work at the hotel are verry friendly and helpfull. At breakfast you have lots to choose from. Different freshly baked bread, cakes, etc... Every day something different which is nice. The only thing that bothered us a little bit was that we sat with lots of people in a smaller place te have breakfast. There was a lot of noise and it was a bit chaotic. The rooms were clean yet smal. We stayd in 1 room with 3 people and there wasn't much place. The bathroom was allso small but clean. Overall we were verry happy with our stay there and if I were to go back to Istanbul I would stay at the same hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: Smappe
Reviews.Content: I booked Romance Hotel with the package of flight+hotel with very reasonable price during Christmas time. It is close to many major spots to see, and even tram station is next to the hotel, so access is quite handy. Amongst very much touristic restaurants, there are some good "local" restaurants with very good price and value, worth trying. We've got a bigger room than the other rooms according to the floor map so no complaints about the room size however bed for each was rather small. Pillow was a bit hard and high but will not bother much. Free WIFI worked very well with my smartphone. Breakfast was also nice (wish freshly squeezed juice was no extra fee!) On Christmas day there was a small gift on the table in the room when we came back from sightseeing, this was a real surprise gift! We enjoyed taking SPA treatment from the hotel next door and if just for sauna and/or swimming pool, sports gym, it is only 10 Euro, worth utilizing (though I strongly recommend to take form and scrub massage!). Hotel staff are all friendly and helpful, overall I am very satisfied and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “My stay at Romance!”
Reviews.Author: MÃ©lina M
Reviews.Content: Thank you for our stay. Very nice staff and very good service. We will come back, in our furture travel in Istanbul. Thank you so much to all and see you soon

Reviews.Title: “Great Chrismas visit”
Reviews.Author: Johan S
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Romance Hotel over Christmas and it is so perfectly placed and give such so lovely service, so our stay was absolutely perfect with lots of very nice memories.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable, quiet & conveniently located - at a reasonable price.”
Reviews.Author: Zedvictorone
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were very happy with the quality of accommodation, food and service. It's very handy for all the main city "must sees" and close to some good restaurants. The staff were helpful and friendly. Some redecoration was going on in a near-by room during our stay (which was out of season, so this was understandable). When we mentioned to the duty manager that this was a bit intrusive, we were immediately offered an alternative room on a different floor. All was carried out with good grace. I'd happily go back.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: yksheb
Reviews.Content: excellent location ,its at walking distance to majore historical sites and if u wana go another places, the tram stop is infront the hotel so u can move easly...also there r many restaurants, pubs and coffe shops around ... clean..... very helpful staff.....and breakfast is good... the only thing the rooms r a bit small but is not a big issue

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: TeresaNorthants
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance of Blue Mosque, Hafia Sofia, Grand Bazaar and Spice Market, this hotel is in an excellent location for touring the city. Very friendly staff and nice rooms. Good breakfast and all very clean and well decorated. Good restaurants all around. Can recommend the Olive Rooftop Restaurant at the sister hotel next door with beautiful views of the city and very good food. Also the New Hatay Restaurant just around the corner where Fikni will found us an excellent window table and we had an excellent meal with the "fire show" when the meal is cooked in an earthen pot at your table.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, friendly staff, beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: BillVanAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I was passing through Istanbul and decided to stay a night. I wanted to stay in the Sultanahmed area of the city but every trip advisor recommended hotel was full. (I wonder why) so I decided to just go to the station and "come again another day". On the way down the main drag to the station from the Aya Sofia I saw the Romance and decided on the off-chance to see if they had a room. They did and it was excellently priced (I'm not telling you how much; do your own haggling!) Room was a double, spotlessless clean - more a mini suite that a regular room. Bathroom also spotless, plenty of towels and "bathroom accessories". Breakfast was substantial and of suberb quality. The staff at the reception and throughout the hotel were friendly, smiling people as, indeed nearly the whole population of Istanbul seems to be! Head receptionist, Sinan Oktem, is a true gentleman. I will visit Istanbul next year with my lady friend and I will book the Romance well in advance to be sure of a room

Reviews.Title: “Neighbor before the house”
Reviews.Author: Eyad H
Reviews.Content: Neighbor before the house .. Famous words of Arabic means that the good neighborly relations are better than the home comfortable. I find in Romance Hotel, only the highest levels of dealing upscale ... ... Starting from the hotel manager, through the friendly reception crew ending with the technical crew ... Honestly my family and I were very happy and satisfied as we have seen in the splendor of each aspect desired by the tourist. If you arrive to the hotel simply by asking for Mr. / Sinan (Hotel Manager), inevitably you will find the help you're looking for, Really he is a Respectable person and own a high degree of culture or Mr. / Sadek with a smiling face. There are many hotels in Istanbul, and I swear they all do not have such staff in Romance Hotel... Honestly I loved all the staff Mr. ( Sinan - Sadek - Hatem - Samad and others ...) every next visits to Istanbul (Romance hotel ) will be my place. The hotel is clean and tidy .. , Suitable for families, located in a very special place ... Food is delicious and fresh. Definitely you will find the Turkish hospitality. Finally .. All What I can Say :) ((Thank you Romance Hotel for making our visit to Istanbul enjoyable and successful)). All the best for All,,, Eyad S. Hassan Kuwait @20/10/2011

Reviews.Title: “comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: Travellovergeelong
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Romance hotel for two nights after a 16 day tour of Turkey. It was the first time for me in Istanbul and I was very happy with my experience there and the Romance made it even better, the bed was a double which was a good start because everywhere else we stayed they were singles, the room was small but clean and comfy with a great breakfast each morning and free wi fi. Staff wwere amazing from the time we walked in, nothing was too much trouble for any of them and the head receptionist Sinan was a true gentleman that never stopped making sure that everyone was looked after from the time we arrived till the time we left. The hotel is also in a great position for walking to the Grand Bazar as well as the waterfront and the tram runs right by the front door. There are also many restaurants in the area which was nice and convenient. If ever we find ourselves in Istanbul again we would not hesitate in staying at the Romance again

Reviews.Title: “HelenaK”
Reviews.Author: HelenaK55
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Romance Hotel at the beginning (4 nights) and end (5 nights) of a recent three week tour of Turkey. This was my first trip to Turkey and an absolutely fantastic experience. The Romance hotel is centrally located to the old part of Istanbul and that worked well for me. It was walking distance to the main sites that interested me. One negative - when I arrived, I was dropped off by the shuttle company at a street behind the hotel and instructed to walk my luggage down to the hotel. I was not expecting this. This was because the street running in front of the hotel is very busy and the trams run along it so vehicles are very limited for drop offs and pick ups. It is very convenient if one wants to catch a tram, which I did and the system is very easy. The first stay, my room was very small with no chairs, table or stool, this was difficult for writing, or working on my computer. The second time I asked for a room with a chair and ended up with two, a small table and stool and was very happy with this setup. It was good to have Internet in my room, very helpful. The staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was very good. The hotel was very clean. Good value for money and I would stay again if I return to Istanbul. I went on a group tour of Turkey and stayed pre and post tour at the hotel and felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: zilli
Reviews.Content: Stopped by Romance Hotel for two days on my way back from a business trip. I have been going to this hotel for more than 10 years. As always, the staff were very friendly, the rooms were great, the breakfast was to die for, and Mehmet the "masseuse" is divine. Sinan in the front desk is excellent and ensures that customer service is top-notch 24/7. For those of you who like to have a home away from home, Romance Hotel is the place. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Right in the centre of the old city”
Reviews.Author: FraserdeFox
Reviews.Content: This nice old world hotel was just part of our tour but it was great. Good service, helpful reception staff, excellent breakfast buffet, and evening meal on the sidewalk if you don';t want to explore the myriad restaurants nearby, Clean rooms, amd well kept air conditioned rooms, some bigger than others, with double glazing if you don't like the sounds of the old city and the buzz of city life out side. This hotel had the old world ambience that we hoped to find and I would definately return. On the tram line and a short walk to a lot of the places people want to see. And free Wifi as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: anne239
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel twice in the last few weeks as part of a three week tour of Turkey. While the rooms are not big, the hotel is in an excellent location and everything was clean. The first time we stayed the wi-fi internet worked well in our room, but it was not so fast on our second visit. The staff were extremely friendly and remembered us when we came back the second time so it felt like home! I would recommend this as a cost effective hotel in the heart of Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommendable”
Reviews.Author: swatibadani
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant 3 day stay at the Hotel Romance. It is very close to the Blue mosque and Hagya Sofia and the Grand bazaar. Very good breakfast and very friendly and helpful staff. Very glad we selected this hotel. Good shops and eating places all around the hotel. Would definitely stay here again if we go back to Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “perfectly placed”
Reviews.Author: Ewan C
Reviews.Content: I stayed eight nights at the Romance Hotel whilst at a conference in Istanbul - I found it the perfect place to stay - within easy walking distance of all the main sites (so I could be there early before the crowds), just a stroll from a wide selection of restaurants, with a great breakfast and friendly and efficient staff and a good price. My conference was in a more crowded and modern section of Istanbul, but I wanted to stay in the historic heart, the tram stop just round the corner from the hotel got me over to Karakoy in 10 to 15 mins. The Akbil (Istanbul's version of London's Oyster card) made it very easy to use. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The right place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: MimiMiouMiou
Reviews.Content: Good location (close to Topkapi, Ayasofya, Basilic Cistern, ...), welcoming staff (thank you Hakan, Sadik, Akin and the others). Nice breakfast choice. Very clean hotel. Glad of my choice for this trip :-))

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, helpful & friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: schilgy
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Romance hotel. Goode value for money. Located near Topkapi palace & within easy walking distance of many major tourist attractions, loads of restaurants and only a cheap taxi ride into the new city center. It''s quiet & peaceful inside, especially given the noise outside. I'd stay there again, but Internet didn't work in my room at all, changed rooms, not much better though at least it worked in the lobby... but slow,drops out occasionally and the login doesn't always work first time...wasted a lot of time with it. They seem keen to improve so maybe they will. The beds were very hard...I'm used to a king size bed, so a hard single bed wasn't much good for sleep or my back.

Reviews.Title: “Good little hotel in a Great location”
Reviews.Author: Dr_Kingdice
Reviews.Content: We booked our room as part of a package through a well know "no frills airline". We was not disappointed with this hotel, Although the room was perhaps a little on the small side but very clean and fully functional. Staff helpful. Lots to see and places to eat / drink, in easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “good for a short citybreak......”
Reviews.Author: zagos
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a short visit in Instanbul. The hotel is located in the old city center in walking distance of Agia Sofia , Grand Bazar etc. The hotel is clean - the staff friendly and polite. Simple hotel ''nothing special' but a good value of money! For our next trip we will try a hotel in the modern part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: mary196874
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in late July and early August of this year and the one good thing about it was its location. The rooms were extremely small, the breakfast buffet was not very good and most of thee staff could not speak any English. I really don't understand the "rave" reviews. We would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply amazing”
Reviews.Author: Meena_Wamidh
Reviews.Content: On our first time to Turkey we tried lots of hotels which most we didn't like, then on our second trip there our friend told us about Romance hotel so we thoght of giving it a shot and it was so AMAZING to the extinct we went stayed there on our third time to Turkey :D The staff are so lovely and helpful, and the position of the hotel is extrodinary for it's in the middle of istanbul, it's one minute away from the tram, and what ever you need is just near whether a restaurant or a touristic place. The breakfast is so dilicious and so are the lunch and dinner. Furthermore the rooms are big and comfy. This hotel is highly recommended and I'd definetly stay there if I am to visit Istanbul again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PatG1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after leaving another place at midnight. The previous place had no hot water and I was ignored by the front desk. I just left. I spoke with the person the day before about the problem and he asked me not to leave. I said I would stay if the water situation could be improved, then nobody would answer the phone. I want directly to the Romance Hotel and loved it. Great room, excellent breakfast, very nice. This is a good spot, nice staff...good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, accessible and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Salzu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 nights at the hotel. From check in to check out the process was seamless. The hotel is within walking distance to all the historical sites and tram line. The staff made our stay comfortable. The staff are fantastic. We will definitely stay at Romance again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: sher0
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located walking distance from the tram line and most of the renowed landmarks and historical sites (as well as shops, bars, restaurants and all the local takeaways !) and their rooms reasonably priced, quaint and spacious. The breakfast buffett was small but tasteful and balanced in variety, and the staff friendly ^_^ travelling with my mum and aunt, our stay was pleasant and we plan to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, highly recommended, will stay there on our next trip”
Reviews.Author: GeoffAustralia
Reviews.Content: Originally booked in to Olimpiyat but not good for family with baby, so they arranged for us to stay at their sister the Romance Hotel (that was good of them). Cannot speak highly enough of Romance - don't be put off by the name, not a luxury hotel but wonderfully adequate for our stay with a baby; excellent staff; breakfast very good; short walk to the Mosque, Topkapi etc - short tram ride to the Grand Bazzaar.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location - A definite Must Stay place”
Reviews.Author: JacquiB1979
Reviews.Content: We have just completed a five night stay at the Romance Hotel and cannot recommend it enough. The staff were so friendly and helpful. The rooms are big, modern and spotlessly clean. The bathroom is also spotless, very modern and has all amenities. The hotel is in the heart of the Old City and in walking distance to all the main attractions of Istanbul as well as being right at a tram stop, should you need to take a tram anywhere. There is a lovely cafe/restaurant next door which we ate at many times, called Faros - the staff are also so helpful here as well, so be sure to go there and eat as well. The hotel includes a buffet breakfast which is really good and has everything on offer, from fruit, cereal, hot foods, breads etc etc Again, I mention that I highly recommend this to anyone visiting Istantbul.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: khurram1970
Reviews.Content: just got back from beautiful Istanbul and the staff at romance were brilliant. They were very friendly and helpful. Hotel great location just five minutes walk to aya sofia and the blue mosque. Hotel very comfortable and great for the price. Staff always had a smile on their face which made us feel welcome. Room service was amazing and reasonable. I went with my Wife and daughter and we definitely would recommend this hotel to everyone we know. Thanks guys at Romance specially Sinan. Airport transfers in chauffeur driven air-conditioned Mercedes Benz very nice!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location!”
Reviews.Author: Sooflim
Reviews.Content: Very good location, the hotel is also very clean. Breakfast is so so but the great location compensates everything. We walked to the Topikapi Palace one morning, and forgot to bring our umbrella (started raining), we can actually turn around and go back to hotel the same instant and changed into our water boot, and continued touring the Palace with umbrella... :-) very convenient and price is fair, and it is not noisy at all even though there is the tram near by.

Reviews.Title: “Nice bouteque hotel in main area of old istanbul, Palace quarter.”
Reviews.Author: freddyblogger
Reviews.Content: Nice modern hotel, in great location. Tram route just outside and easy walking distance to most tourist attractions in this area including Blue Mosque, Grand Bazaar. Also close to ferry/bridge to other parts of Istanbul. Reception attentive and spoke English, as do most of the people we met, but they really appreciate it if you at least try some Turkish words. Rooms were small and basic, romantic style rather than feeling I guess, but comfortable enough. Best of all was price included breakfast and this was a decent feast, and plenty of it. BE WARNED! This is an incredibly busy city, noisy and crowded. Watch when crossing the road, and strolllers and wheel chairs etc are not catered for, but locals seem to pitch in if they see someone struggling... so don't be alarmed if some smooth talking local tries to help your wife across with the buggy! We ended up in the wrong end of town, and ended up being invited to a local birthday party... and tea! They drink loads of tea...

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location.....”
Reviews.Author: goldcanyonbb
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romance is really a 2 or max 3 star hotel. Rooms are quite old, very small and we were disappointed with the reality after reading so many of the previous reviews. Rooms were clean and daily room service was good. We were there 2 nights and then 1 night 2 weeks later after our tour of Turkey. Front desk service was also good, but we didn't bond with any individual personnel. Breakfast was really good, better than even some of the true 5 star Hotels that we stayed in during our trip around Turkey. Hotel location is excellent! Couldn't ask for better, close within walking distance to many major sites and the tram is right outside the door. Lots of shops and restaraunts right there. I would recommend it if you go in knowing that it's dated, but you're not going to spend much time there anyway.

Reviews.Title: “great location for sightseeing and excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Ditchling
Reviews.Content: The Romance Hotel is located right on the No1 tram route which runs almost continuously, which means it's a 10 minute trip to get over the Golden Horn and up the tunel into the bohemian quarter (where the best selection of restaurants is). It's a 5 minute walk to the Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and the Aya Sofia, and a 10 minute stroll to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice Market. The main ferry and tourist boat dock is again about a 5 minute walk. The hotel itself is basic and clean. The rooms are reasonably equipped and have a/c (although we didn't need to use it), although the shower temperature was erratic. Service was excellent, and we pre-booked the hotel's airport pickup service which also worked faultlessly (they charged E80 each way for the 4 of us, which made it only just a bit more than the shuttle, and much more convenient). Breakfast was included, and again, apart from the orange juice (they charge 4TL for the good stuff), was excellent value. The Yasmak sister hotel just up the alley has a roof top restaurant with views to the Aya Sofia mosque, and we were encouraged to use that as well. There's nothing to beat a late night raki on their terrace contemplating the Aya Sofia! We were delighted with the hotel, its location and the price.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Romance Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Lyse-Scott
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Romance for a week in April. It was actually our honeymoon, as we had just 'eloped' in Italy on the 22nd and then flew straight to Istanbul. We also had our 12 year old daughter with us. The room was very spacious - #111 is apparently the largest. We were disappointed that the suites did not have 2 separate rooms and were quite small, so we opted for the larger room even though we were all in together! The bathroom was also really big - great shower pressure, hot water and very clean. We were asked to hang any towels that we didn't want washed (environmentally conscious) and we did, but they washed them every day anyway! There was a small couch, table, TV & minibar in the room but no tea or coffee making facilities, which would have been preferred. The beds were very comfortable with great pillows, lovely linen (they were made each day) and the room was warm, clean, modern & comfortable. Being on the ground floor there was a bit of street noise - early morning workers & a nightclub nearby that quietened down once a complaint was made. I think you're permitted to smoke in the rooms as we could smell it occasionally in the corridor and our room had an ashtray (we don't smoke), but we didn't see anyone smoking in the foyer or anywhere else. The foyer was lovely - lots of tables & chairs with a TV, a bar and the restaurant. I would like to see some more couches to sit around on in the evening. The breakfast was fantastic with cereals, cooked choices, breads and sweetbreads. The freshly squeezed orange juice was an extra 4TL, which I didn't understand, but it was beautiful. Hotel Romance was in a fantastic location. Right outside the door was a tramlline which took you straight to the Bazaar (amongst other places). The neighbourhood was lovely - lots of hotels, restaurants and shops and easy walking distance to the Bosphorus and Spice Markets. Directly opposite was a fantastic Turkish restaurant - Capadocia - more expensive, but great food and atmosphere. Directly behind the hotel was another fantastic restaurant that was very laid back & cheap and the staff great fun. You could sit outside on couches/pillows to eat, under gas heaters, which was a lot of fun to watch people pass by. Hotel Romance is affiliated with the Hotel next door, which has a restaurant (Olive) with views of the Bosphorus and Blue Mosque. We didn't eat there, but went and had a look. There is also a Turkish Bath there, which we did try - very interesting and quite an experience and glad we did it. I have no idea how much more expensive it is to have one there than elsewhere, but it was about $90-100 AUD. Wifi was free on my iPhone but it was 5TL for half an hour on the foyer's computer. I think this should be free like other hotels. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. We could not fault them - anything we asked they would do. We sat at the bar most evenings and they even allowed us to have our wedding bottle of champagne down there (even though we didn't purchase it from them - that would never happen in Australia!) They would stay and chat and we loved their company or they would leave us to be alone. We could leave our luggage there when we travelled down to Gallipoli for ANZAC Day (at a small cost) which was very convenient. We would like to make special mention of staff members: Sadik and Sinan who were absolutely lovely, however ALL the staff were wonderful and attended to all our needs. Istanbul is an incredible city and we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, perfect area”
Reviews.Author: Ralfdejong
Reviews.Content: The staff in the hotel was very helpfull and made our stay very pleasant. The hotel is located on a perfect spot. You can walk to all the highlights in the old city; Blue Mosque; Aya Sofia, Bazar, Spice Bazar etc. A little further away? Take the tram that stops at 200, of the lobby. Looking for a great restaurant? Try Faros (across the street or Olive 50m)

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: Sorbo1510
Reviews.Content: The hotel is comfortable with the basic amentites. But what makes the stay worthwhile is the location. All major attractions are within a five minute walk or less! We really did not have to bother ourselves with public transport at Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Long weekend with the family”
Reviews.Author: Sesse44
Reviews.Content: The Romance Hotel had the best location ever, we could sleep with open window even though it is in the middle of everything. The staff was always kind och very helpful. the rooms were clean and ok showers. Close to all the sights and terrific food where ever we went. Close to tram and buses. We enjoyed the stay and I will absolute stay at Romance hotel next time. Istanbul is a lovely city with a fantastic atmosphere. DonÂ´t forget to visit a Hamam, I loved it. Sesse

Reviews.Title: “Not a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: 100Traveller100
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romance is really a 2 or max 3 star hotel. Rooms are quite old and small and service is not so good as one could think after reading these reviews. Only thing that is excellent is hotel location. But if you are looking a true 4 star hotel, keep looking, hotel Romance is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Short Stay with Good Amenties”
Reviews.Author: selly14112
Reviews.Content: I came for exhibition in Istanbul. Made a good choice of staying in Istanbul downcenter. After my business meetings, I can enjoy seightseeing and walking in old town. Hotel has good location and easy access. It is OK for short stay since my room was small room. Average comfort. No need to spend more time in Hotel since quite limited time in Istanbul this time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Olga-AS
Reviews.Content: Very nice and friendly stuff, excellent situation in the heart of historical city center and quality/price relation is adequate

Reviews.Title: “nice stay in a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: anomni
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located very near to amenties of istanbul. they have nice service and professional. room was nice especially the breakfast tastes was interesting. I guess it is mediterian kind of stuff. However nice to be in roof restaurant. recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay,peaceful,comfortable and hospitable.”
Reviews.Author: MarkPrescott
Reviews.Content: A beautiful place to stay for the traveller on a budget.Very hospitable staff and an amazing breakfast.Rooms are cozy and quiet,but the city and surrounds mean that you won't want to spend much time in your room.I will be back in 12 months time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service greatstaff”
Reviews.Author: ibz_26
Reviews.Content: my time in istanbul was a great experiance thanks to the romance hotel staff. they helped in all areas including directing me to excellent restaurants and tours. the hotel was of good value and i would defenetly visit again. many thanks to the kind staff of hotel romance. ibz

Reviews.Title: “You'd love it as we did”
Reviews.Author: kuolaxy
Reviews.Content: It is our second stay in the hotel. We chose it for its excellent location in the historical center of Istanbul - so you can easily get to the major city sites without using public transport. Staff is freindly and very attentive to our needs. Room (we booked a suite) is clean and home-like with all supplies needed for guest comfort (bathroom supplies, TV, minibar, free wi-fi, safe). Breakfast offers a variety of choices, so everybody will find something to his\her taste.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant staff”
Reviews.Author: Cris_Klimt
Reviews.Content: Nice location (pretty close to Topcapy Palace). It is easy to walk from there to the rest of the cultural atractions (Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia, Bazaar,...).

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, Safety and Clean”
Reviews.Author: AustraliaConniegirl
Reviews.Content: A big thankyou to the staff and especially Simone for our recent stay at the Romance, Istanbul. We were always greeted by friendly staff, ffgelt safe and had no questions regarding, location, cleanliness and safety. Have stated there twice and wouldn't stay anywhere else. Well done

Reviews.Title: “The Romance Hotel in Istanbul is simply brilliant!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dharmilla
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Romance Hotel in Istanbul between 16th December and 22nd December 2010 with my stay extended for an additional night on account of adverse weather conditions and the considerable travel chaos and disruption apparent at European airports in late December 2010. My room on the 5th floor of the Romance Hotel was very clean, well maintained and beautifully furnished in line with the hotelâ€™s romantic theme. Although this would clearly not have affected other guests staying at the Romance Hotel, I had found my room to be a little on the warm side during the early hours of the morning coming to the hotel from a cold climate such as England and on account of the fan heater in the room being quite powerful - although the temperature can be easily adjusted in the room using the monitor to suit individual preferences once you are familiar with the controls. The duty manager at the hotel responded by offering me a complimentary room upgrade to a larger junior suite on the 3rd floor for the remainder of my stay which had resolved this minor problem to my satisfaction and was very spacious, comfortable and homely. What makes the Romance Hotel so very special and makes it stand out to the vast number of hotels on offer in Istanbul is the sheer warmth and capabilities of the hotel staff; from the very friendly reception to the efficient and highly competent restaurant to the immensely attentive housekeeping. The reception staff, in particular, had simply gone out of their way to make my stay as comfortable as possible. The Romance Hotel is also located in an excellent location with the light railway only a short stroll from the hotel providing ready access to popular parts of Istanbul such as Taxim Square (only a couple of stops away) as well as being within walking distance to tourist hot spots such as the Blue Mosque and Grand Bazaar. I had very much enjoyed the tasteful evening meals delivered to my room with such a lovely smile using the Hotel's room service facilities. I also dined and lunched at the excellent Olive Restaurant located next door in the sister hotel which welcomes guests from the Romance Hotel. When I needed to spend an additional night in Istanbul on 21st December, I did not hesitate to extend my stay at the Romance Hotel and was actually sad to leave behind the exceptionally kind hospitality extended to myself during my stay and the tranquil and very delightful hotel surroundings. Also, the hotel must be considered to be excellent value for money by European standards. Being a boutique hotel, it is expected to be smaller in comparison to the larger chains, however, this in my view actually leads to a much more personal and satisfactory experience at the Romance Hotel. Consequently, I returned to England fully refreshed from my short stay in Istanbul and I am certain that the Romance Hotel was a large contributory factor towards this being a haven of peace, comfort and beautiful surroundings. In summary, I have no hesitation in highly recommending the Romance Hotel to prospective visitors of Istanbul. You simply cannot go wrong in choosing this Hotel for your business or leisurely needs as the hotel staff will take care of your every need. I very much look forward to my next stay at the Romance Hotel in Istanbul and wish the hotel and its fantastic staff many more years of continued and much deserved success.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible location and service”
Reviews.Author: Abdullah2005
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very centrally located with many tourist locations at walking distance. Nice and cosy ambience. Very friendly and courteous staff. We felt at home and would definitely consider staying at the same hotel when on vacation in istanbul

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service & Location!”
Reviews.Author: sajaid
Reviews.Content: The service provided by all of the staff was brilliant from the very outset. Manners, smiles and general helpfulness is provided in abundance. The staff gave us great advice on where to eat and shop without getting ripped off so it is always best to ask reception for general advice such as this. It will end up saving you a small fortune! The rooms were decent in size with spacious bathrooms. The showers are especially good. The only complaint I could make was that the room temperature guage never seemed to work regardless of how many times you adjusted the temperature. The location was absolutely fantastic. You are literally within 100 metres of everywhere. My mother is very elderly and can barely walk 100 metres so being so close to all of the main attractions, monuments and bazaars was fantastic. The hotel is very well run and the continental breakfast on offer is also very good. I would definitely recommend the Romance Hotel to all Visitors and would stay there again when visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “central and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Micknannie
Reviews.Content: We (couple in our 60s) stayed four nights at the Romance. We found it more than satisfactory in every way. the location is excellent and we could walk to all the most famous places. If too tired on the way home the excellent tram runs right past the front door of the hotel. the room was comfortable and clean and breakfast excellent. We found the staff very helpful and obliging. It was recommend to us by friends and we would certainly recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Sanna_helsinki
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Romance for 7 nights in November 2010. The hotel is located very conveniently: close to all the main sights, easy tram ride to Galata's side and to the ferry terminals, good restaurants nearby. The hotel was nice, clean and comfortable. The staff is very helpful and the breakfast was ok. The best rooms (most quiet) are the ones facing the side streets rather than the main street (with the tram track) I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent service & Location”
Reviews.Author: ZahraIstanbul
Reviews.Content: We- me my wife and our young 4 year old daughter stayed in the Hotel Romance for three nights end of October and three nights at the Faros Boutique hotel, we were on our anniversiry holiday to Istanbul - wonderful/beautiful Historical city! At the time of booking I was looking through previous trip advisor reviews to go ahead with hotel Romance. When we arrived at the hotel, checking in was swift, our room was ready, however this was inside part of the hotel, the room was slightly bigger than outer rooms. I wanted a room looking out onto the main street in front side of the hotel. My room was changed at the same time. The hotel has a decent size looby to relax and unwind, there is also a bar & resturant. Good variety buffet breakfast was served between 7-10 other than that everything is on the door step of walking out of the hotel. All the staff speak English and are very helpful specially the manager Mr Sinan Oktem. I would recommend this hotel for its excellent service, value and Location.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plong18
Reviews.Content: Very friendly hotel. The people are very nice and very helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location, a few steps from the main Moschees from Istanbul, the tramway run right in front of the hotel but the street is pedestrian. My room was very quiet. Excellent breakfast. Try the massage: it's excellent! I would highly recommend the Romance Hotel! Gisele, Switzerland

Reviews.Title: “Our fifth year !!!! Still great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGirlsLondon
Reviews.Content: Another fantastic trip to Istanbul and staying at the Romance Hotel - perfect. Our thanks to all the staff for making our stay such a pleasure with special mention to the Lovely Sinan and of course Akin who always go out of their way to ensure we have everything we need, from booking restaurants, organising taxis nothing is to much trouble for them. We couldn't want for me. Hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to the Spice Market and Grand Bazzar and much more. See you in 2011 - The Golden Girls London

Reviews.Title: “Combiling business with leisure”
Reviews.Author: anvas
Reviews.Content: Excellent location. Close to everything you want to enjoy and abit away from places you may want to avoid in Istanbul (which like any big cities has good and not so good places. Very friedly, helpfull staff. Cleajn rooms. Could have been a bit larger but still very good value for the money

Reviews.Title: “My 6th visit in Romance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marinamadu
Reviews.Content: what can i say about romance hotel,everything is clear i think,because i visited Romance hotel with my sister for the 6th time:) what do you think what is the reason:)))? not only the unique location of this Hotel,when u can watch almost all the sightseeings of Istanbul from the views of the hotel,but also the brilliant service,hospitality,friendly atmosphere and staff's professionality.

Reviews.Title: “The Romance was reliable with every question and always respectful of a single female traveller.”
Reviews.Author: LouTickner
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous traveling to Turkey by myself but staying at the Romance was easy and always comfortable when I entered the reception. They were always prompt and polite with answers to my questions which made me feel like I could ask them anything. All staff spoke English and greeted you with a smile. I was very grateful for their resource of local knowledge as being a first timer to Istanbul they made life easy which aloud me to focus on sight seeing. Staying in a great location was also fantastic as everything was in walking distance from trams, trains and ferries to the sultanahmet where all the great sights are to see. My room was always clean and tidy when I returned home from a long day out and when I needed a needle and thread or a booking for the Turkish baths, they always went out of their way to find them for me. They passed on messages as soon as I got in and remembered my friends and were just as happy to help them as well. I think the best way to compliment them is by saying when I come back, I will be looking up the Romance Hotel and booking me and my family/friends in for our entire stay. They really did help make this a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The proximity to the sites in the old city is perfect for tourists.”
Reviews.Author: raeeda
Reviews.Content: Good: It's on a main road which is important especially at night with a number of cute shops all along the street that are open late unlike the bazaars. It's a five minute walk to the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofia, Basilica Cisterns and the Arasta Bazaar. It's a two minute walk to the tram that takes you all around the city including the new city. It's a charming hotel with great staff, especially one of the concierges, Samet. Decent breakfast every morning. Not so good: Room decor is outdated. There were no glasses in the room when you just want a glass of water at night. We were on the first floor and outside our window was a restaurant that we could see and hear at night even with the windows closed. Overall-- was nice as we were our sightseeing most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “The most perfect hotel to have a wonderful stay in Istanbul!”
Reviews.Author: Biberli
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just perfect in every way. Very friendly and helpful staff, even if many people were at the reception. Rooms very clean and with a modern, nice and warm ambiente. Great located with the tramway station just in front of the hotel and many historic sites reachable in just a few minutes walk. We surely will come again! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A memorable stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: BeirutMustang1966
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Location is simply strategic, it is near and at a walking distance to many and major historic sites in Istanbul, also it is near the Tramway station which will take you to almost anywhere in Istanbul. The staff are all professional, polite, helpful, english educated and informative, they answer your questions and inquiries with a smile on their faces. Very clean rooms and nice furniture, free wireless internet services. The breakfast is nice and lots of variaties are served. In simple words, the hotel is awesome, I will definitely stay there again...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, very friendly staff and good location”
Reviews.Author: Cheesecake_10
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay here. The staff are extremely helpful/friendly and the hotel is situation very close to the historic parts of istanbul with the tourist attractions close by. The only problem we faced was the lack of Air conditioning (cooling) which was auto set on heater and it took us some time to figure that out. Rooms are rather small but clean and its good value for the amount paid. Breakfast was sumptuous, however there is no restaurant in this hotel for Lunch or dinner purposes. We had to rely on room service.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind, helpfull and very nice Romance Hotel Staff.”
Reviews.Author: hocine62
Reviews.Content: it was a very good stay in Istanbul, I'll never forget it, all Romance Hotel Staff was very nice and welcoming he (Staff) has facilitated the task during our stay, especially Mr. Sinan Oktem & Mr. Hasim Aslan they are very nice guys, I appreciate their help. By the way I would like to thank all Romance Hotel personal, I hope come back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice!”
Reviews.Author: angel_morena_24
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights. It is 5minutes walking distance from Topaki Palace and Hagia Sofia and Blue Mosque. But better yet, there are so many stores and restaurants to shop at along the trolley line. It is a great to take time and take a walk from Eminuou to University stop. The hotel staff front desk was excellent: they called us cabs for our trip back to airport and to clubs on the other side of the Bosphorus. This is a no frills hotel, but very quaint. Rooms are small and windows open to the bustling street and restaurant/outdoor cafes next door. So there is noise until about 3am. Breakfast was cereal, breads, cheese, cold cuts, fruit.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: karim091
Reviews.Content: we have been booked at romance hotel through our friend how owns a travel agency, he recommended romance hotel highly , and he was correct in his recommendation, in fact we found it even better, so if we ever came to istanboul again we'll be satying in romance hotel.

Reviews.Title: “cosy experience”
Reviews.Author: RayJogs
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romance indeed lived up to its reputation of great hospitality and location as conveyed by Tripadvisor's reviews and ratings. A warm and cosy place with excellent location on Gulhane street within walking distance of the Gulhane tram stop and most tourist attractions such as the Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Gulhane Park, Topkapi palace as well the Bosphorous ferry point. Hotel staff provided excellent and prompt response. The rooms are small and the breakfast basic, however, the location and charm compensates for these minor shortcomings. The street where the hotel is located exudes a charm of its own at night with the place filled with cafes and restaurants and tourists who dont seem to get enough of the place. all basic facilities such as exchange centres, travel agents and food joints are all a stones throw away from the hotel. A certain recommendation to all those travellers who do not wish a 5-star luxury but instead want to feel Istanbul for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “hasim aslan=romance hotel wonderful”
Reviews.Author: apolt21
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel i liked it.it is very clean good server breakfast espacialy hasim he is good helper men i had lots baggaj he helped me and i forget tips he said me please i am working for this hotel and my experence i don t need your tip please don t worry about it and i schoked he is wonderful thank you for good vacation i will come definitly again i promise

Reviews.Title: “Good Friends All Around!”
Reviews.Author: drnjsmith
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend Romance Hotel, the staff is super friendly (most of them) and all are very helpful. The rooms are small but adequate and quaint. I stayed a couple of days, left a few more, and returned for another week, and would have loved to have stayed longer. The hotel is well located to catch the tram, and walk around old Istanbul. The price is very reasonable with a great spread for breakfast, tasty food. The mattresses were a bit hard for me, but I like mushy mattresses!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Jinger58
Reviews.Content: I travel to Istanbul on frequent occasions for family reunion as I love Istanbul, the culture, and the Turkish cuisine. Everytime, I try a different hotel in the historical neighbouhood of Sultan Ahmet. Last June I stayed in Romance Hotel, just a walking distance from Aya Sufia Mosque. The employees were very friendly and cooperative, and always available around the clock. Hotel itself was clean and quiet. Olive restaurant, with overlooking the Bosphorus, is a plus for Romance Hotel. Comparing other hotels in that neighbourhood, the price was competetive and affordable. However, Turkey is going to be a more expensive country than it used to be. Congratulations to the manager of Romance Hotel for this nice and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very close to tram stations, clean, calm, friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: timtimkloten
Reviews.Content: realy good hotel near comfortables tramstations and shopping street. but there is no noise in the hotel room. friendly reception.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, with excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: Cintia30
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 night in the Romance hotel and it was great. It has and very good location, walking distance to the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque, Hafia Sophia and Grand Bazar. Warm and Helful staff, and excelent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Good Value, Enjoyable Trip”
Reviews.Author: SteveS10
Reviews.Content: This hotel has an excellent location and was a good value. It was a a short walk (maybe 10 minutes) to Topkapi Palace, the Aya Sofia, Basillica Cisterns (a must see), the Blue Mosque, and Grand Bazaar (15 minutes). I chose the Romance hotel based on the positive ratings on TripAdvisor and the location. My main concern was comfort and location as my father is in his 80s. We had two double rooms - one was a good size and bigger than I expected, the other was smaller (two twin beds separated by a night stand) and not a lot of extra room. I have travelled extensively in Europe so I knew the rooms would be smaller than US hotels. My sister and Mom commented on how nice the bathroom was. The breakfast was much better than we expected. There are plenty of restaurants on the street behind the hotel, and shops as well. The Romance is part of a group of hotels all near each other. We had dinner at the Olive Restaurant in one of the other hotels based on the staff's recommendation. It was a rooftop with a nice view of the Aya Sofia. It was a buffet, and felt a little touristy (there was a tour group there, and it was one of the few places we saw Americans on the trip). It was a little pricey for a buffet, but the food was quite good, the service was very good and they even brought out soup for no charge when my dad asked if it was possible to get a cup. The restaurant also had a regular menu we could have ordered from. While it was a good meal, and a decent price, we would have rather had a more authentic dining experience. The hotel staff were friendly, particularly Ugur (a bell hop I think who walked us around the corner to the other hotel for dinner). You can book sightseeing tours from the hotel (a plus), although it felt like one front desk clerks was pushing us to take the Topkapi tour even after we said we weren't interested because the tour didn't include seeing the Harem (which is the most interesting part of the palace). We did book a 1/2 day tour through the hotel for a Bosporus cruise and that was worth it. I would recommend this hotel - it is neat, clean, a good value in an excellent location. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful people, great atmosphere, very reasonably priced hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pinkblonde00
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights here. Not a luxury hotel but a very comfortable low-frills place with friendly and helpful employees. Service and quality where it matters! I would absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic friendly hotel.”
Reviews.Author: alfie03
Reviews.Content: Staff really willing to help, excellent location. Really friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “We felt like being at home”
Reviews.Author: Maria86_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice,very clean and the stuff was also very helpful.The situation of the hotel is very good too because is near all historical monuments and near shops (grand bazzar and spice bazzar).We had a great time and we hope that we will visit istanbul and romance hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at reasonable price in Istambul”
Reviews.Author: Tibor_45
Reviews.Content: We had an excellent stay for 5 days in this hotel, which is in the center of the town, next to historical buildings. Rooms are large, well furnitured, bathroom installations are convenient, Staff is extremely careful; especially Sinan Ã–ktem receptionist provided us very good advices about sightseeings, restaurants, cafes - all his recomendations we found the best choice. The hotel has reach tourist programs, sightseeing tours, and relaxation facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sanne-Elleny
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Romance for 4 days and enjoyed every day of our stay!!!!! The hotel is perfectly located near all the touristic highlights. The staff is very helpfull! And the guys of the reception are very friendly at all times, always willing to help their guests. The rooms are clean and decent, but not very big. On the other hand is the bathroom spacious. Clean towels and shampoos every day. We also enjoyed one of their massages and it was great! We would really reccomend this hotel to anyone who is planning to visit Istanbul. Don't forget to visit restaurant Faros, the neigbour restaurant of hotel Romance. They have great food, good atmosfere and they make every visit to a huge success because of the high service! They also dance!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: NadineDinibini
Reviews.Content: I have been coming back for years to this same hotel (every year I am on a one week business trip in Istanbul), and I love it. Great value for money, super nice people, always helpful. Location couldn't be better. I will keep coming back here!

Reviews.Title: “Really friendly hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: HastingsBirder
Reviews.Content: Our two friends stayed here with us for 4 nights. We all loved the friendly staff which greatly added to our stay in Istanbul. The location of the hotel is a few minutes walk from the Topkapi Palace and other sights. After a long day sightseeing and queuing its is great to go down in the hotel to the sauna and allow the resident masseur, Mohammad, to do his stuff and set you up for the local restaurants. There are many surrounding the hotel. The Romance's sister hotel is adjacent and has excellent views over Istanbul. A word of warning. Istanbul is not cheap. I never found a glass of wine less than 10TL which is about Â£5. Beer is usuaaly 8TL. Never let a shoe shine chap do your shoes then discuss payment! I got into a terrible argument with this chap and eventually paid 10TL Â£5. My shoes only cost Â£10.

Reviews.Title: “pleasure in sunny colours:)”
Reviews.Author: marinamadu
Reviews.Content: Romance hotel is the best place that i can't replace with other ones,i had visited this hotel for the forth time with my mother.It's the most suitable place to reach all the sightseeings of the old city,as for the hotel it it has very positive atmosphere,perfect stuff and service,and it is the wormiest place,specially for me.I visited several hotels in istanbul but i can say with whole my hart i can't change this hotel and it's comfort to another ones.

Reviews.Title: “Turkey is a beautiful place!!”
Reviews.Author: Caribbean_Princess1
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul for the first time with 2 other female friends and we had a BLAST!! Ofcourse, this was mainly because of the peopleâ€¦and our accommodation made it all the more fun. If you are visiting Istanbul â€“ the place to stay is definitely ROMANCE HOTEL!! First the Location cannot be beaten â€“ it is central to everything a sightseeing tourist desires!! Just outside and to the right of the hotel (~5 NYC blocks or 8 Chicago blocks) is the Blue Mosque, shopping, Hagai Sophia, shopping, many Turkish restaurants and side walk vendors, the Grand Bazaar, shopping, the double decker tour buses, etc., Did I mention loads of shopping? Turn left from the hotel (within 4 NYC blocks/6 Chicago blocks) and this will lead you to the Spice Bazaar, and for those who MUST eat McDONALDS, yes one is there, Bosphourous tours, shopping, Many Turkish restaurants, Mosques, Orient Express train station, banks with ATM (word of caution â€“ best to use the ATMs during the bank business hours or do a cash advance using the teller with your ATM if have mastercard logo; I had an â€œincidentâ€� but was corrected once I got home). AND for those areas just a bit outside Sultanamet, well, the TRAM station is ~100m to the right of the hotel or you can venture out on the Orient Express train. Accommodations - The hotel room was small, but very clean. The bathroom is very modern and after a long day, the high powered shower heads was welcoming to my tired body. I also had a room next to the elevator which was super quiet â€“ did not disturb me at all. Honestly, we spent very little time in the rooms except to sleep and store our goods from shopping. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet tremendously!! After fueling up in the morning, we did not need to eat again until it was time for dinnerâ€¦even with all the walking we did! The buffet had something to suite anyoneâ€™s taste â€“ boiled eggs, egg over easy, scrambled eggs, sausage, potatoes, variety breads, pastries, fruits, variety fruit preserves, coffee, orange juice among many other foodsâ€¦.and ofcourse tea!! Atmosphere â€“ I was surprised at just how friendly all the Turks are...seriously! Not sure what I expectedâ€¦.but totally enjoyed the warmth of the folks at Romance hotel when I first arrived and it seem to have spilled out to all of Istanbul! Let me tell you, Sinan, the front desk manager, is a precious GEM!! He is very knowledgeableâ€¦and if you listen to him, you will not go astray and guaranteed a fabulous time! All his recommendations were superb and top notch! From the trip to Izmir (Ephesus and Pamukkle) to our return and the Turkish night out experience at the Orient Express! He even knew the best place for my friend to get a fabulous haircut!! Sehmat (I think I spelt his name correctly, tall thin guy with black hair and dark rimmed glasses) was very kind and quick to offer help even when we had questions late at night! The whole crew at Romance Hotel loves their job and it showsâ€¦ and they do it very well! I will be returning to Istanbul as I still have more places to visitâ€¦and yes more shopping too! I will definitely be staying at the Romance Hotel! Thanks Guys! C.M.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel worth staying at again.”
Reviews.Author: Queckers
Reviews.Content: Location fantastic-100m from a tram station in the heart of the old city. Walking distance to the bizaars, ferries, palace and endless numbers of shops. Staff were fantastic- friendly and knowlegeable about the area. Hotel/airport transfers relable. Rooms are small but perfect if you are planning to be out and about. I would most certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Elena Z
Reviews.Content: Went with a friend for a week to do a little sightseeing and shopping. Hotel is located right near a tram stop within a walking distance from a lot of sights and shops and restaurants. Trams are quiet so there isn't much noise from them. There is a mosque couple of streets away and with open windows you can hear the call for prayer starting 6 o'clock. But I must say that it never woke us up or bothered us in any way. But in Istanbul it'll be hard to find a place far away from a mosque. The staff is very welcoming and helpful. They have an elevator so you don't have to walk the stairs. The only thing I want to mention is they have smoking and non smoking rooms. If you don't smoke, specificaly ask for non smoking room because otherwise the room will smell like old sigarette smoke. Right now the neighbouring hotel is having a small renovation. They start working around 8 am. Other than that, the hotel is wonderful and I definetly recomend it for your stay - whether its for couple of days or for couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “it's really good hotel to stay.”
Reviews.Author: alexhan
Reviews.Content: it's really gorgeous hotel. and located in really good place.Breakfast was also delicious. Hotel Inear to topkapi palace grand bazaar and blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly,good location”
Reviews.Author: GreeceLeon
Reviews.Content: very friendly staff, from the reception until the cleaning-ladies and the waiters everybody very helpful good breakfast,has everything you need dinner we did not try rooms and public areas are very clean good location,very close to old town WE WILL ADVISE THIS HOTEL TO ALL OUR FRIENDS!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience in Istanbul and nice stay at Hotel Romance”
Reviews.Author: UThailand
Reviews.Content: Hotel Romance is great -- comfortable, clean, lovely and good service. The staff are polite, friendly, helpful and kind. I really like the cleanliness and nice breakfast itself and setting. It is convenient to travel to the conference venue and other places. The tram service is in front of the door. I would recommend you to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Full of amenities in best price!!”
Reviews.Author: KUNMINGENT
Reviews.Content: We are very proud of staying in Romance Hotel of Istanbul in Jan. 2010 for a week. Your airport pick up service is great & on courtesy level.
