We received a warm greeting at the front desk while checking in and the hotel is as clean as before we stayed in Nov. 2009. The staffs are courteous and helpful. The rooms are tidy and well furnished with good amenities. There are varieties of delicious food and fruit as well as juice for choosing in breakfast. Overall speaking, we appreciate with Romance Hotel with good memories.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: leo187
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice staff was very friendly, loved the location close to all tour sites. breakfast is very good at this hotel, wireless internet is fast and free of charge one of the best prices you can get. this was my first time stay in this hotel in Istanbul will always recommend it to everyone. thanks for making my stay here to all the satff never complained about direction graet specially Mr.Sinan questions and was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just best!”
Reviews.Author: kuolaxy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 6 nights in a suite (two bedrooms with a connection door). Cosy and lovely room, with all necessary bath accessories, carefully cleaned. Nice and kind staff, always ready and willing to help, but basically we did not have any problems. Excellent breakfast, just cannot try everything you like to. The hotel is conveniently located, about 10-minite walk to main attractions, 1-minute walk to the tram station, shops, restaurants and cafes. Many thanks for making our holiday so nice and memorable, we had great time!

Reviews.Title: “verry good Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: ugur956
Reviews.Content: I was very happy to stay in this nice hotel.. it's very clean and very warm people work in this hotel... I recommend evrybody to stay in this hotel... p.s The restaurant is very good,and have a very beautyful viewe on the Bosporus... And thanks for the reseption ,they where very helpfull... Thankssss... Ugur..

Reviews.Title: “Nice and cosy, really friendly and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: HediiTallinn
Reviews.Content: It was lovely to stay in this hotel - cosy and neat, with incredibly helpful staff who did their best and more, esp as I got quite an unexpected back-ache on the very last day.The location is really good for the traveller who wants to explore the city - the most important sights to see and the Bosporus are just a walk away. Good choice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: windband
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, the location is perfect for tourist's as you can walk to most major spots or take the tram from right outside the door. Breakfast was nice and the hotel staff was able to accommodate all our needs. Thanks for everything. -Dan

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kezzyhomeros
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Romance Hotel for 8 nights at 4th floor's main street side room with city view. Generally we enjoyed our time at this hotel and can recommend this hotel for travellers who are looking for a good value hotel with very good staff and service. The rooms are clean and acceptable. Curtains, carpets and furnishing have been renovated recently, but they need to do some renovation on furnitures too in near future. Good points: - Perfect location. Restaurants, shops, historical places, public transport is at walking distance. - Nice LCD TV with lots of international channels - Bathroom was clean and constant hot water with very good pressure. - Polite staff, always ready to help and most of them know English. - Room cleaning service is good, but can be better. We've got our beds changed and our rooms hoovered once in 8 days of stay. I don't know, maybe we were too clean. - Breakfast is same every morning, but it's fresh and good quality and variety of food. Includes boiled eggs, scrambled eggs, turkish pastry-borek, turkish white cheese (feta), turkish kashar cheese (like dutch gouda or edam), fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, butter, turkey salami, chicken jambon, good variety of jams, freshly baked little turkish breads, turkish bagels, croissants and sliced bread. Coffee, tea and concentrated cherry juice are accetable. Fresh juices are not free of charge. Bad points: - Walls between the rooms are paper-thick - Minibar was full of out of date drinks. - Windows are quite high and covered with plants, So you can't see outside properly. A room with City view means view of opposite buildings' window frames - Area is very busy and lively, if you're looking for a peaceful evening you cannot get it until 1 o'clock in the morning. Double glazing windows are blocking most of the noise though - Poor lighting in the rooms, couple of wall hanging orange lightshades don't help.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel In The Old City - Review Video Included”
Reviews.Author: Zac-FashionTV
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Istanbul to complete some filming for a travel / fashion TV show about Istanbul. I have been to Istanbul a few times and stayed in various Hotel including the Ritz Carlton and Conrad, but this time decided to stay in The Romance Hotel in Sultanehmet. Here is my full review: Location: I was travelling with my family, so it was important for them to be within easy reach of all the Old City attractions, and important for me to be able to get around without Taxiâ€™s. Romance Hotel is literally 1 minute from Gulane Station, and so getting around was easy. I walked to the Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace and Hagia Sophia in 10 mins. Sultanehmet Main road and Grand Bazaar is a 25 minute walk. A very enjoyable walk though even though it was pouring down with rain when we were there. Location is VERY SAFE even at night and extremely central, Tram Station is really convenient. Once at night I took the tram in the pouring rain to Sultanehmet, 1 stop to buy delicious cakes, I was there and back in 20 mins. If you want to be in easy walking reach of all of the Old City you cannot ask for a more convenient location. Hotel Services / Staff The Romance Hotel staff are amazing, because they are efficient and knowledgeable. They all speak English and are really friendly. I stayed in a Suite which was comfortable and spacious. I was greeted every morning by smiling faces, they do a great job of making your stay comfortable. The hotel also has a salon and Turkish bath for some serious papering. Breakfast: Breakfast is pretty typical for Istanbul, with lots of cold meats, cheeses, yogurt, fresh fruit, lots of breads and real fresh jams. Tea / Coffee and a small menu of hot food like boiled and fried eggs, fried potatoes, mushrooms as well as hot traditional Turkish pastries (Spinach, Feta Cheese â€“ Yummy). â€¦â€¦etc. Very healthy and plentiful. Great way to start the day. There were always 2 - 3 waiting staff around to help and fresh juices available on request. Local Restaurants / Shops Right outside the Hotel there is a selection of shops, and some amazing Restaurants. The hotel itself has a restaurant located opposite which is fantastic, and Faros restaurant next door is pretty good too. Within walking distance there are pretty much any shop you can imagine, and a wide selection of Restaurants. In conclusion, I have stayed at a few five star hotels in Istanbul, but found their location to be appalling for leisure, hours in taxiâ€™s in Istanbul traffic. I will â€˜definitelyâ€™ be staying at The Romance Hotel again. I found its convenience and location to be perfect. The Tram station outside the front door is really convenient. I loved the staff and for the price, I doubt there is a better Hotel in the areaâ€¦â€¦â€¦â€¦ Please check out the Video of Romance Hotel I posted. And Pics: http://www.tripadvisor.co.uk/ProfileGallery-i22959983.html Special Tip: Divane Restaurant is well worth a visit, itâ€™s on the Sultanehmet Main Road, not far from Tram stationâ€¦â€¦â€¦.. yummy food, mixture of traditional Turkish and international, and really nice surroundings!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: irfanjavrawala
Reviews.Content: hi , i am a travel agent and stayed in hotel romance for 5 nights..i had a wonderful experience during my stay ....hotel is really nice and staff is really helpful including manager sinan oktem .....rooms are clean and breakfast is good but i got bored of eating same food every day .....well my overall experience is good .... thanks ... irfan

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in historic Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: history_lover_21
Reviews.Content: This is our third hotel in SultanAhmet - the historic section of Istanbul. My wife and I love this hotel. We have had good stays at all of our other hotels, but this one is by far the best. We are here on something of a 2nd honeymoon, and this hotel has made all the difference for us. It is located right across from the tram (above ground metro), right in the center of a number of restaurants and shops, and only several blocks from the Blue Mosque, and other historic sites. The narrow stone roads give the neighborhood a wonderful cozy feel. And everything is in reach -- one night my wife and I wanted to eat out at a fancy restaurant, and we only had to cross the street. I wanted to buy some fresh bread one morning, and there was a bakery only 3 doors down. I often go to the Mosque to pray, and there are many nearby including the famous Blue Mosque. Yesterday, I needed an adaptor for my laptop, and there was a electronics shop down the street... although in this case, the hotel was kind enough to lend me their adaptor free of charge. :-) The service is excellent. Their hospitality is great, as it is everywhere in Istanbul. They are concerned for you as a guest, and they don't nickel and dime you -- service is there when you need it and given graciously. Among their accommodations, the wireless internet here is better than my internet at home.. true high speed internet. They have a fitness center, which we didn't actually use, and they have "tea time" in the afternoon... unlimited tea and cake for a small price. Clean, spacious rooms are very important for me and my wife. Fortunately, the rooms are very clean, especially the bathroom. The bathroom is sizable, which is an issue at all of our other hotels. It includes a shower and a tub with a spa-like space on the side to sit and wade your feet in the water. They even provided robes. A nice addition is that the room service is intelligent. The rooms have a smart system that lets the room service know if you are in the room or not. They only clean the room if you are not there, and it makes a big difference to not be disturbed if you are sleeping in. Finally, I would like to comment on the breakfast, which is several courses and huge compared to all our other hotels. I especially love the apple tea that they serve and the great meats. I would like to recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Istanbul -- especially if you are coming on your honeymoon, since they will make special accommodations for you. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Friendliest, Cleanest, and the Best Hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: zilli
Reviews.Content: I discovered Romance Hotel ten years ago. The location was perfect--near all the museums, shopping, and good restaurants. The reason I keep going back almost every year is the fact that they have excellent service and the friendliest staff. The rooms are clean, airy, and most functional. The front desk staff are superb; they have answers to all of my questions from renting a car to buying last minute UEFA game tickets to arranging a Bosphorous Tour by boat. The hotel also offers wireless internet service free of charge to rooms which is most welcomed. For my rental car, Romance had free parking with a valet so I didn't have to worry about the details. Over the years, I have recommended friends from Europe, Africa, and the States to visit Istanbul, and they have all enjoyed Romance Hotel. My family members use Romance Hotel as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic Location Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: lovehussain
Reviews.Content: istanbul isnt the most child freindly place in istanbul but this hotel had a ramp and was much better then others, its location is great, the tram station is one minute walk away and very clsoe to shops and nice local resturants. topkapi palace is walkable to and blue mosque is two stops on the 1.5tl tram. i definetly recommend this hotel as the staff are extremely freindly, breakfast is great, and location is perfect to access the best locations and have a good time. also free wireless internet is very handy

Reviews.Title: “Very Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: saffian
Reviews.Content: The first time I enter the hotel I feel confortable as Ramazan and Ugur has welcome me in very friendly manner. Location of the hotel is just too good for us as a tourist as all the interesting place just in a walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “great servÄ±ce and good staff”
Reviews.Author: roguepunker
Reviews.Content: me and my parents are stayÄ±ng at thÄ±s hotel many tÄ±mes.romance hotel Ä±s more than a hotel for us Ä±t Ä±s lÄ±ke our home. The food *the servÄ±ce* the cleanlÄ±ness are superb. the locatÄ±on also Ä±s Ä±deal as all the museums and spÄ±ce and grand bazaar are around the corner. the hotel also provÄ±des wÄ±reless Ä±nternet free of charge whÄ±ch allows me to be Ä±n touch wÄ±th my frÄ±ends and famÄ±ly all over the world. whenever Ä± have a questÄ±on the front desk Ä±s very frÄ±endly and helpful. my parents and I want to come back next year to Istanbul and stay at Romance.

Reviews.Title: “I FELT LIKE WE WERE AT HOME”
Reviews.Author: abdullahmashallah
Reviews.Content: To the Department of Romance Hotel .. Respected. We offer sincere thanks and respect to Sinan and his administration in this Alphenq which faced, Raienah good deal spectrum and direct the services required of the resident and myself, and my family were pleased in all aspects of services, including breakfast, cleanliness, good manners, .... Etc Ajca and all of us It is difficult trip to Istanbul to stay in this hotel managed by the modest presence of high-end With greetings and my family

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Romance exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: Deal-breaker
Reviews.Content: Originally from the UK but now retired and living in the Bodrum area of Turkey for the past 2 years, we have just returned from our first 'proper' holiday in Istanbul (previous visit was a brief one-day visit during a cruise several years ago). We were lucky enough to pick the Romance Hotel for our stay! We could say nothing bad about this hotel - the room was a very decent size and spotlessly clean, the hotel staff were charming, the breakfast buffet was delicious - with a choice of cooked or Turkish-style breakfast, cereals and fruit - and the location was perfect for all the major tourist attractions. Extremely good value for money and we will definitely be returning next year.

Reviews.Title: “More than I expected!”
Reviews.Author: ARSAngola
Reviews.Content: When I remeber Romance the first thing that comes to mind is the excellent breakfast!! :o) Great food and variety to start a long day off sightseeing! Then the simpathy of all the staff, honestley nice and willing to help, in english or spanish! The hotel is nice, clean and tidy, with all the commodities on might want. Last but not least, excellent location! Half way from Eminonu and Aya Sofia, with tram and boats nearby. Congrats!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very good breakfasts and superb staff”
Reviews.Author: MWoolcot
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for sight seeing. The service from the staff was superb, decor of the rooms require updating, good local restaurants and bars nearby.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast!”
Reviews.Author: Ieatgreentea
Reviews.Content: My sister and me stayed there for 3 days. We enjoyed it! The hotel is pleasant and friendly. The staff is helpful any time of the day - thanks guys for all your help and smiles!! I'd like to point out that breakfasts were HUGE and DELICIOUS. What a selection of meals - they really makes sure nobody leaves the hotel hungry. Location is great. It's a 10 minutes walk from Aya Sofia and basically from the historic heart of Istanbul Pardon me, EVERYTHING in this amazing city constitutes historic heart! I particularly like the business centre at the hotel where I could easily get everything printed and ready for business. Internet, fax, printer - they have it all. They also have spa services which we didn't have time to try. The hotel is fully equipped to make you stay great. I would definitely recommend it to anyone. Thanks a lot, Romance, we miss Istanbul!!

Reviews.Title: “location was excellant and staff so friendly and helpful”
Reviews.Author: dee044
Reviews.Content: we stayed in the hotel in september the room was a little small but we were changed immediately to another room which was bigger the manager selan and all the staff were so courteous and friendly they made our stay so pleasant the location is beside all the major sights and their are plenty restaurants nearby i had the turkish bath in their sister hotel i found it disappointing in and out in 15 minutes the scrub was not very invigorating also oil massage is extra where in others this was included in the price we look forward to a return journey to this great hotel

Reviews.Title: “Happy Customer”
Reviews.Author: lmorrison04
Reviews.Content: After four consecutive years of visiting the Romance we are treated as family ! I visit with a girlfriend for a few days while our children are away on half term break. We are made to feel welcome , safe and secure and even requests for Green Tea, Gordons Gin and Amaretto are met. The location is within walking distance of the sites and some very nice restaurants, The rooms are spacious , clean and tidy although the bathrooms could do with a make over in the not too distance future.. ! The staff are always happy to help and with a smile wether it be booking a restaurant or finding a taxi .. Which doesn't happen often as trams run from just outside the hotel. My bags are packed roll on September Romance here i come 2010 !!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, the "romance" is in the decor.”
Reviews.Author: DrVegaPunk
Reviews.Content: Great and helpful staff. Put up with my demands for ice (my foot injury plus being on a walking city break!), plenty of towels and bedding. Decent breakfast, lots of watermelons!

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: traveller71Finland
Reviews.Content: My wife and i, had an miniholiday in Turkey October 2009. We had a very pleasant stay in tiny little hotel called "Romance" in Istanbul. Hotel staff made everything to get us corfortable, even let us to choose between two hotels and room types before taking one. We travelled with a couple who have seen quite a lot, but even their opinion was that service in Romance hotel was unique. Greetings and thank you"s!! Petri from Finland

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: shinmacs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romance Hotel in Istanbul for five nights; this was our first visit to Turkey. We found the hotel to be clean and comfortable. The staff were very accommodating and the location, a 50-meter walk from the Gulhane stop on the tram was perfect. This location permitted an easy walk to most tourist attractions, shopping, restaurants, the Grand Bazaar, and Spice Bazaar. The restaurant at the hotel was very good as was the waiter, and the included breakfast was great. We would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Our fourth visit and are planning our 5th”
Reviews.Author: GoldenGirlsLondon
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our 4th visit to Hotel Romance and again we had an amazing time, and yes we want to go back!!!!! The Manager, staff , everyone concerned in running the hotel go out of their way to ensure you have everything you need. From booking restaurants, taxi's, trip's nothing is too much trouble for them. The location of "Romance" is ideal everything is within walking distance, from The Spice Market to The Grand Bazzar to The Blue Mosque and much more. Please keep our room available for September 2010 we cannot wait to come back and see you all again.

Reviews.Title: “we have been very fortunate to stay at the Romance hotel-excellent”
Reviews.Author: angelintraining
Reviews.Content: The romance hotel is a wonderfull place to stay in Istanbul. We really liked staying at the Romance. it's a good choice for the first time travellers. The location is very convient to explore the city of the Ottomans. It's located not far away from the main historical sights of this wonderfull city. It's in the very heart of Old Istanbul . The rooms are clean and nice .The service provided by the hotel was excellent. The staff was helpfull and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “very, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: TerezeM
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel several times. I love this hotel because it's like my home. The staff is very friendly and helpful. The hotel is very clean and cozy. The hotel is in the middle of the history because all historical things very close from hotel. There is a wonderfull restaurant in their sister hotel next door on the top floor. It has wonderfull views and foods. I recommed everybody to taste their food.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Paisleypeople
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our stay in Istanbul and the hotel and all its staff added to our wonderful trip. The staff were exeptional, especially Sinan - head receptionist, so knowledgeable and helpful to us new visitors to the city. We found the hotel clean, a great location in relation to all those places already mentioned in the reviews below. Breakfast was plentiful as was the complimentry fruit available opposite the bar and the room not too small. Althought the tranway runs past the front of the hotel the double-glazing blocked this out. We saw the ISO 9001 award and boy do they work hard to maintain standards and take on suggestions from guests to keep improving - we suggested the plates to be heated for hot food. We ate at the Olive Restaurant at the Yasmak Sultan, sister hotel, the food (heated plates), service and views were first class. As for Istanbul - the day we choose to visit Taksim Square we experienced a demonstration in full swing - water cannons and teargas! In the middle of the madness we were invited into a restaurant to shelter offered tea & coffee and the staff refused payment and were apologising for the inconvenience it was causing us. This is just a small example of the friendliness, politeness of the locals and for such a big city a unique experience. We would recommend this hotel to future visitors to Istanbul. Caroline & Gordon, Paisley, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “Review of Romance Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RaluCaranfil
Reviews.Content: good and clean rooms nice staff good service good food excelent location

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter16343
Reviews.Content: We were very pleased to be staying in this hotel which was located within walking distance to Blue Mosque, Sante Sophia, ferry for trip up the Bospherous. Staff were extremely helpful. Rooms was clean and comfortable. Breakfast was more than adequate. Safe to walk out at night. Restaurants in abundance within couple of minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “...had a wonderful experience... staff very friendly,helpful...thank you guys....”
Reviews.Author: chicago708
Reviews.Content: ...had a wonderful time .hotel very clean,cozy,and comfortable...everything more than i expected..thank you...yr staffs very friendly,and helpful that is really important,especially if it's yr first visit .my fiancee loved it too.thank u guys....i strongly recommend this hotel.you'll enjoy for staying there...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a tourist trip.”
Reviews.Author: RexinLondon
Reviews.Content: Staff were friendly, hotel is clean. Some said the rooms were small, this was not our experience but perhaps we were lucky. Another said wireless didnt reach their room--they have a router on each of their 5 floors, so this issue seems to be fixed now. Breakfast was good, location is good. The negatives: bed was all springs. Shower would give normal temperature water for 98% of your showering time, but then surprise you with 1 second blasts of ice cold or scalding hot water. Good for waking up in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “The loveliest staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Lauraella
Reviews.Content: We were really pleased with the hotel. We paid about half the price we should have for rooms as we got a good late deal. The staff were really friendly andwelcoming from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. We actually found the same of all Turkish people in the area. It's positioned in the old city. It's a great part of the city to stay in as you are round the corner from the main tourist attractions (Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque, Cistern). It is half way between these and the bridge crossing over to the Galata Tower and the new city. It just had a nicer vibe round there than in some other areas. Was a little more relaxed but that's relaxed in Istanbul terms, with Istanbul being a very busy city. I could only really fault the place on the comfort of the beds. They were fine, a little creeky, reasonably comfortable but I've stayed in slightly better. Having said that, it really wasn't a problem and I would definitely stay there again, without a doubt. Some really good points were that the cleaner seemed to clean at whatever time you left the room. Whenever I've been a late riser in other hotels I've generally missed out on having my room cleaned. Breakfast is 7:00-10:00. Check out is 12:00. They'll hold your bags for you after check out. Another amusing thing to mention is that we arrived back in the room one day to find they had fitted a purpose built fold away shelf for my suitcase which had just been positioned on the floor below! It's possibly interesting to some people to know that the hotel is a Yasmak hotel and the had two sister hotels right next door. You were able to use facilities of the sister hotels as if it was your own. At least that was what I was lead to believe. I never actually tried.

Reviews.Title: “like at home”
Reviews.Author: nadocairo
Reviews.Content: its nice to stay in Romance hotel , we stayed about 13 days here , there is a very nice stuff they are working hard to make you feels like you are at home .. and thats what we really felt . And sure we will not forget " MR. SINAN " he was very frindly and helpfull and very good persone . the best other thing in romance hotel is that it has a very nice location near sultan ahmet , yeni camii (( the new mosq )) and aya sofya and lots of historical places . about the rooms its very nice and clean rooms and have a very nice views and comfortable , the brackfast it has a very nice varity and good taste . here in Romance hotel if you need any help to go to any where dont hisitat to ask the reception they will help you alot .. if we will come to istanbul really we will come to ROMANCE hotel :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in ideal location”
Reviews.Author: sally c
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to all the main attractions the Blue Mosque Haghai Sophia and Topkapi Palace are all just a short walk away as is the Grand Bazaar.Theres plenty of places to eat nearby and their restaurant food is execllent. The staff are all friendly and helpful, the breakfast are a feast and the rooms are spotless, have stayed here before and would highly reccomend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel to recommend...”
Reviews.Author: pabloAT
Reviews.Content: Me and my Wife stayed at Romance Hotel Istanbul for a long weekend. I strongly recommend this hotel: their location is ideal if you are planning to visit Istanbul for a short period of time, everything is close from there and the tram is only at few meters from the hotel. The personnel is very friendly and helpful and the service and breakfast are very, very good. Rooms are a bit small, but...who cares about that !

Reviews.Title: “good staff”
Reviews.Author: Ryo1989
Reviews.Content: I think It is several reason that I was good to stay at this hotel. Even, the anxiety of the solitary journey was solved. by the correspondence of the hotel staff . Due to the fact that been received warmly and able to enjoy it Istanbul very much. Being able to gain access on foot even to where in, the old street even the location of the hotel to, except for it it was very convenient. And also I think if I want to stay, if it sometimes comes in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: mmechas71
Reviews.Content: Our recent stay was unforgettable. Especially the front desk whÄ±ch was lead by Mr. AkÄ±n, was very attentive and kind. The hotel is clean and Ä±t's a great value considering it's location.

Reviews.Title: “it served its purpose”
Reviews.Author: pfl2
Reviews.Content: It is beautifully situated between most major sights in Istanbul old town. Rooms were small but had served their purpose. The bathroom was clean-watch out while showering the water would go EXTREMELY hot without notice. Staff were friendly breakfast was well.....edible. For the value cant really complain-however if we ever go back to Istanbul I would probably shell out a few more deneros and stay somewhere a little more nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OttawaBen
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in this clean, comfortable hotel- though I have never, ever seen such tiny elevators - they worked just fine, it was just amusing to see an elevator so small. The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfasts were wonderful. As mentioned in previous postings, the hotel is well situated making it easy to visit the many must see sights in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “i ll stay again”
Reviews.Author: creative6666
Reviews.Content: i ve stayed in romance hotel 10 days.location was great.blue mosque,topkapi palace grand bazaar were very near by walking distance.the stuff was friendly and helpful.rooms was clean and comfortable.also they have sister hotel just next door and there is turkish bath in this hotel after walk all day if you want to relax you should go there.if i come to Turkey again i ll stay at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “A lovely centrally located hotel”
Reviews.Author: luluhem
Reviews.Content: A lovely centrally located hotel extremely close to the major tourist sites. Staff very friendly and obliging and hotel breakfasts very good. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place for a great price”
Reviews.Author: ljanson
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a little gem for the price I paid. The room was small but nicely decorated and very clean. It looked out on a small street and was quiet. The bathroom was a good size, big shower, everything in tip-top shape and clean. The staff is very friendly and helpful at all times of day and night. Breakfast buffet food is abundant and good. The location is fantastic, 5-10 mn walking distance to Sultanhamet and the tram stop is just around the corner from the hotel, it takes one mn to get to it. I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, good, clean hotel with good service”
Reviews.Author: SSVPX
Reviews.Content: The Romance Hotel is in a great location, right in the heart of the old Istanbul, Sulanahmet. Within walking distance or a short tram ride away to the tourist attractions, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, Grand Bazaar, Spice Bazaar. The hotel itself is clean and cosy, we were given a choice of two rooms which was nice (only thing is that there were only twin beds but we could push them together so that was fine). The staff were helpful, giving advice on where is good to eat and where to visit. We would definitely stay there again next time we are in Istanbul as it is a great place to come back and get your head down after exploring the city. S & V from London

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & kind Staff”
Reviews.Author: MicItaly
Reviews.Content: Perfect location: just beside Topkapi palace, but in a quiet small street. Clean rooms and a tasty and greedy breakfast! Special mention for the kind and helpful staff, starting from Ramazan, the nice guy working at the reception.

Reviews.Title: “within walking distance of old city”
Reviews.Author: gill145
Reviews.Content: brilliantly situated in the old part of town in easy walking distance of many of the old attractions. Clean small hotel, very friendly and helpful staff. Good value

Reviews.Title: “Great Clean Hotel”
Reviews.Author: fox8099
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 3 nights in Hotel Romance. It is an excellent location to all sites, which are within easy walking distance. I found the room to be very clean and the air conditioning worked perfectly. The staff were also very pleasant and accomodating. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: suki013
Reviews.Content: Great location in the heart of Istanbul. Friendly helpful staff, and clean rooms. Not the most comfortable but nonetheless good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: PeterDuesseldorf
Reviews.Content: Overall I have stayed five times at Romance Hotel so far and I enjoyed each visit. The Hotel is coneniently located in the heart of old Istanbul (Sulanahmet) and all major touristic attractions are within walking distance. The staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are small but clean and cozy. I can highly recommend this hotel and I am loking forward to be there again.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel - not what I was expecting from the reviews”
Reviews.Author: travellernick121
Reviews.Content: It's with sadness that I have to write this review, because I had such high expectations from it judging from the past reviews from visitors here. My friend and I booked the hotel through an external website and we were led to believe that the hotel was a '4 star luxury boutique hotel'. Part of the reason why we were disappointed was admittedly due to the fact that we had been missold, but the rest of the bad review is due to the hotel itself. Not all was bad, but the bad points outweighed the good... When we arrived at the hotel we were impressed that the receptionist was very friendly. We're sure if we needed advice about tours he would have been the best person to go to..we didn't though because we prefer more independent travel. Then...we were shown to our room! TINY does not begin to describe it! I'm not saying I wanted palatial standards, and was expecting cozy, but this was incredibly small. It was room 202, and 2 tiny beds were fitted barely 40cm apart from each other. We weren't too happy so we asked if there was an alternative room but there wasn't. We were told we could store our suitcases for us (there was seriously no room for these in the room!) without us having to climb over the beds to get to the door). We did comtemplate this, but since there was one small wardrobe in the room we couln't take up this option. Some of our clothes stayed in our suitcases instead and we took them out as and when we needed them. The first night we slept we had an awful sleep because the springs in the bed were digging into our back. We tried to see if we could get used to it, but after the 3rd night with 3 restless sleeps we spoke to the friendly receptionist. He seemed sympathetic, but we knew nothing would happen...they were hardly going to buy a new bed just for us. The other problem with the room was that the bathroom was tiny as hell, and the shower door was broken. Once again we mentioned this to the receptionist...he said he would pass it onto the manager but yet again nothing was done. We just got used to having a shower with the door open but this meant that the water went all over the bathroom floor. The breakfast was okay...it wasn't bad by any means, just extremely limited. Cheese, some some spam-like ham, salad and bread, plus cornflakes with dried fruit, and coffee/tea/squash. We went there for the first 2 mornings, but didn't bother after that, and decided to simply eat breakfast out. I'm not quite sure where the raving reviews came from...maybe I expect too much from my food or something? :-) The hotels saving graces were that is was clean, the reception was friendly and it had an excellent location. It was right in the heart of Sultanhamet with the Topkapi Palace, Blue Mosque and Agis Sophia close by. We used the tram line lots to get to more out of the way and really enjoyed Istanbul. It has to rate as one of my favourite destinations and will definately go back. I'll be posting seperate reviews on Istanbul later. To summarize..I'm sure that other people had better experiences because their rooms were of a far superior quality. Ours should have been classed as a single bedroom...and then it would have been fine. As a twin room though, it's vastly overpriced and it's shameful that any establishment should try and market itself as such - and I'm no hotel snob and have had great experiences in Ibis and Travelodge hotels, along with family B+B's. I'll go back to Istanbul for sure...just not here!

Reviews.Title: “Clean hotel, lovely staff, perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LibertytripS
Reviews.Content: I have visited Istanbul before and knew I wanted a hotel close to the centre of the Old City with the Blue Mosque etc in easy walking distance. It could not have been easier than this! The location is perfect for hitting the main historical attractions and also only a short walk down to the ferries for the Bosphorus cruises. The staff were helpful and polite. We were picked up by airport transfer in a very grand car and the rooms were clean and pretty. Ours had a large balcony too. Sometimes the shower water was a little tempremental but aside from that it was perfect! If you are in Istanbul for the weekend then this is the perfect place as its close to everything you'd want to see and the staff really help you out. My top suggestion for Istanbul is to visit the Seven Hills Hotel's roof terrace. Its the highest point between the Blue Mosque and Haigha Sophia and the staff are super-helpful and friendly. Go at sunset, order a pipe and a beer and some little tapas bits and watch the sun set over the Bosphorus. A little slice of pure happiness. Right there.

Reviews.Title: “Could Not Fault This Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jac562
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location that's easy to find! We got the train (metro) from the airport and just one change onto the tram lead us basically to the door of the hotel within an hour. You can't go wrong if you're walking around town - just follow the tram tracks home! It's within walking distance of everywhere - we didn't get one tram. All the major tourist sights are literally around the corner and the lively area to go out at night (Beyoglu district) is about a 20 minute walk. Make sure you use the fernicular (which is just over the bridge, on the left), as it is much easier than walking up the steep hill! We didn't realise it existing until we'd been there a while! There are lots of great little kebab houses to eat at - we found an absolute gem of a place just before we left for the airport. It was in the Sultanhamet district and it had just opened. It doesn't look like much from outside and it was in the centre of quite a touristy area, but the food was absolutely FANTASTIC! The owners were also really lovely and they were very proud to tell us about how the food is prepared (using the 'knife' method, which is apparently the traditional way to prepare the food, and we didn't see this anywhere else). You really must go and support this little new business - it is called 'Sultanahmet Bufe Restaurant' and is just off the main road (Divan Yolu Cadessi), on a little street called 'Cadessi Bickiyurdu'. It's number 1 along that road (at the end). Fabulous! The hotel was lovely - we had a huge comfy bed and black-out curtains, which meant we slept like babies! The double glazing was fantastic and we were never woken up by the trams or the call to prayer (somewhat surprisingly!). The staff are wonderful and cannot do enough for you! The breakfast was basic, but lovely. All in all, a great stay in Istanbul and a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel - Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: SusanSouthCarolina
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the perfect location. Within easy walking distance to attractions in the old city.We had a junior suite which was spacious and comfortable. It was on the side of the hotel and very quite. But the best part of the experience was the staff of Hotel Romance. They were the most friendly and helpful of any I have experienced in my travels.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but needs renovating”
Reviews.Author: HappyTravelMonkey
Reviews.Content: Perfect location for easy walking to all of the old city and close to transport options for other sightseeing. Staff were great and breakfast nice, if not a bit boring after five days of the same menu. The bathroom needed a good clean and was really due for renovating due to worn out fixtures and leaking shower/bath. No excuse for mould on the grout in this day and age. Room was a little shabby but OK and size was above average. No tea of coffee maker, unlike all our other Turkey hotels. If they spruce up the bathrooms and add a little variety to the menu, we would go back as it is a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good name!!”
Reviews.Author: daboManchester
Reviews.Content: The name attracted us the first time. We wanted a quiet oasis in the evening after a busy sight-seeing day during the week. That is exactly what the Romance can offer. The reception and restaurant staff offer a typical, very friendly Turkish welcome every day. The hotel attracts many different nationalities from Western and Eastern Europe, and the USA. The reception staff are very helpful about the tourist attractions, but never miss an opportunity to make a few Lira for themselves. The hotel is very close to Gulhane metro stop which is very convenient for reaching all the famour tourist attractions. We went back in April this year, and everything was just as friendly. Honeymoon couples should pay attention to the rather thin bedroom walls!!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel in the heart of old Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: SusanRossRobertson
Reviews.Content: The Romance is a delightful hotel, ideally situated for exploring the key sights of Istanbul. What makes this hotel exceptional is the friendliness of all the staff who went out of their way to ensure I had a pleasant stay. From arrival to departure, the staff could not have been more helpful. I have limited mobility and often found getting around quite a challenge but the staff at the Romance were wonderful. While some of the rooms may be rather small, they are clean, bright and perfectly adequate for a city break. Dinner in the Olive Restaurant of the Romance's sister hotel is recommended for both the food and the fantastic views over the city which, when lit up at night, is quite magical. The Romance is in an excellent area, bustling with life and teeming with atmosphere. There are plenty of places nearby to enjoy good food and drink, browse in the shops and banter with the locals. The tram runs along the street and is a convenient and speedy of way of getting around the city. If you are looking for a friendly, convenient and comfortable place to stay, then I would highly recommend the Romance Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Ruby06London
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice and each time thoroughly enjoyed my stay. The hotel is brilliantly situated and the staff are very friendly and helpful. I would definately stay in this hotel again and I highly recommended it to anyone looking for good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, central base for sightseeing”
Reviews.Author: withchild
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel for our ten night honeymoon in Istanbul and were not disappointed. When we arrived they were not aware that it was our honeymoon (even though I had specified this on the online reservation form), but, to their credit, they immediately upgraded us to a suite. Indeed the staff were very friendly throughout (one even insisted on playing table tennis with me!) and offered helpful advice when planning our day trips. Whilst there is nothing extravagant or overtly luxurious, the decor is pleasant and of good order. Our sitting room was a little basic, but the bedroom was cosy and comfortable and the bathroom clean. Breakfast was a self service buffet, but the waiters were always on hand with coffee and tea. The variety was decent, but don't expect the eggs and sausages to be anything like a full English! The 'orange juice' was the low point, being little more than sugary flavoured water, but all in all the food was plentiful and satisfying enough. The location is excellent, being a mere five minute walk from the centre of Sultanahmet and also right beside a tram stop. We found the tram an extremely useful resource when going just a little further, such as to Taksim Square and the Dolmabahce Palace, or even for just those couple of stops back home when exhausted after a day's shopping in the Grand Bazaar. Overall, the location, service and value of this hotel made it an excellent base from which to travel all over the city, and helped make it a very comfortable and memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Could hardly fault Hotel Romance”
Reviews.Author: ankomonkey
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean, comfortable, warm and very well located for the majority of tourist sites. The rooms are a little small but we received complimentary tolietries and slippers which was good for a hotel of this level. The breakfast buffet was satisfactory and similar to all Turkish breakfast buffets we experienced. The staff were very helpful when trying to help me contact my credit card company in the UK and didn't charge me for the call they made when we tried and failed to make a collect/reverse charges call. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: IrishKPF
Reviews.Content: We were picked up at the airport by the hotel. Along the way, our driver pointed out various points of interest. The hotel itself was clean and the service couldn't be beat. If I could change one thing it would be the location of the room...we stayed in a street side room and there was quite a bit of construction every night. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “A lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: thehappyvoyager
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancÃ© stayed at this hotel for five nights! We arrived separately, but there was no problems with check-in, the service provided by the staff upon the arrival was flawless. The rooms were clean and cosy, but it must be mentioned that they were extremely small, but still cosy. Couples with children should perhaps consider another hotel. The room's amenties were what should be expected by a four-star hotel, with clean towels and toiletries, nice sized shower. The breakfast buffe was very tastefull with a wide assortment of teas to choose from, and the other food items were also nicely displayed and tasted very good, they could perhaps have a wider selection, it had a tendency to be same every morning, but I have nothing bad to say about it really. The hotel's location was superb (at least for me and my fiancÃ©), with a lot of famous attractions within a walking distance like the Blue Mosque to mentione one. And public transport is very easily accessable. You can though be a little disturbed by the trams passing every five minutes if you have a room facing the street, but you could get used to that. This is definitely "our" hotel whenever we visit Istanbul, we definitely come to this hotel again, and we would recommend it for anyone else seeking a romantic atmosphere, a cosy boutique-styled hotel, with a great location! I give this hotel 4 out of 5!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at the Romance”
Reviews.Author: aussiegirl66
Reviews.Content: My mother had stayed at the Romance Hotel in Sep 07 and loved it. So when planning my trip to Istanbul I took her advice and booked for a 7 day stay. In fact when I told my mother I was booking she decided to meet me there for a few days. So there we were - mum, dad , myself and a friend. What a great place - it was perfectly located near all the sites of interest, on the excellent tram line and within walking distance of the Grand Bazare, Spice Markets, great restaurants and shopping. I personally loved Istanbul - in fact it now rates as one of my favourite cities. The Romance Hotel was comfortable, clean, hospitable and homey. I found the staff fabulous, friendly and helpful. I plan to go back one day to Istanbul and stay again at the Romance Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Loved my stay - great staff, clean rooms, just down the street from everything”
Reviews.Author: willtravelforfoodnet
Reviews.Content: This was my first time in Istanbul. I chose the Romance Hotel mostly based on the reviews and location. I actually booked a hotel at a more expensive place and canceled due to reviews on this site. I am so glad I did. First of all, the staff was extremely helpful during my stay. I was able to check in at noon the first day and was immediately greeted at the door with someone to carry my bags. The man in charge of reception, Sinan, and the rest of the staff were very patient through my thousands of questions over the last 6 days of my stay. I'm actually in the lobby writing this while waiting for my ride to the airport, of which they arranged along with every tour. A good example of their hospitality happened the first night. I realized I was out of tooth paste and went down to the lobby to see if they had any, as they said when I checked in that it was available. They had a quick look and realized they were out. I said no problem and would just go buy some. They emphatically said no and the manager rushed out the door to their sister hotel and brought tooth paste back to me within 5 minutes. Its the little things like this that make the difference for me. Besides the staff and the fantastic price there are a few more reasons as to why this is a great place. First, the location was ideal. it is located on the tram line, which for someone as directionally challenged as my self, was ideal. If you walk out the front door and take a right following the tracks you get first to Toptika Palace in five minutes, then Sultanahmet Square (Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque...) in eight minutes, and another ten minute walk to the Grand Bazaar - all by following the one train line from your hotel. The other direction will take you to Sirkeci and Galata and some great food and music on the Pier. Of course, for $.80 you can just ride the tram to locations and save your legs a little. There are good restaurants within a block (try Han Kebab House towards Sultanahmet - great food and excellent staff). Another reason I'm recommending this place is the breakfast. The quality is much better than most hotel breakfasts I've had. Perhaps they have upgraded their selection, but the simple bread and cereal selection I've read on other reviews was nonexistent. They had eggs, warm cheese pastry, good yogurts, jams, and tea. I was expecting much less. The rooms are small but very clean and nicely laid out. I had a flat screen tv with a few channels in english, and a nice big window facing the street. The reception is open 24 hours, something you don't always find in boutique hotels. There are some good shops within a block where you can get water and basic snacks -and even a wonderful baklava shop within five minutes. if you aren't expecting a four star American hotel, but rather a nice, clean hotel with a professional staff, great location, and good price, I highly recommend the Hotel Romance. If I come back to Istanbul I will stay here for sure. Feeling safe and comfortable in a new place if you are a solo traveler is a must.

Reviews.Title: “My Fabulous Staying at ROMANCE Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IRINAfromUkraine
Reviews.Content: For me - the main thing in the hotel that makes me feel comfortable - is people. With Romance Hotel it was like that. I fell in love with it. maybe it sounds ridiculous, but i really did! i stayed there only for four days, but I will remember those days forever. i enjoyed my staying there immensely. First thing to mention about this hotel is Staff. The most helpful, friendly, always ready to assist. I came to Istanbul for the first time, alone, so i had worries about many things (for ex, how can i find this or that place without knowing turkish etc.) But during my staying I didn't come to have problems of that kind, bcs I really wasn't alone:) everybody at the Hotel speaking fluent English, also i managed to learn some turkish words :) Second - i LOVED mornings with purely Turkish breakfasts at Romance Hotel!!! Yeah... a)Delicious food! Different kinds of cheese, olives, fresh vegetables, bÃ¶rek, turkish Ã§ay, kahve etc. b)And, of course, pink carnations :) i noticed... they looked so nice and always fresh :) c)and quietness... i enjoyed the quietness of the mornings while staying there. i felt so relaxed and comfortable. I returned to the Hotel late at night - and again i felt that calmness and hospitality. We used to sit with my friend in the restaurant area, having a small relaxed talk, drinking turkish coffee. Third thing - atmosphere... I already mentioned... I never had such a nice feeling of quietness. Fourth - also i noticed (in the morning while having breakfast) that many French and Italian tourists preferred to stay at the RH, also saw some Americans. It was nice to see them there. The worst thing that happened to me at RH was that 4 days flew by like one moment and i didn't want to leave... Everything about Romance Hotel was so romantic... At that time i needed that.... That's why this hotel was a perfect match for me!!! I just wanted to say Ã‡ok TeÅŸekkÃ¼rler Ederim to all those nice people who made my staying so enjoyable and unforgettable! I would definitely recommend Romance Hotel to all my Ukrainian friends who are going to visit Istanbul in the nearest future!

Reviews.Title: “Bad AC”
Reviews.Author: SaudiArabiaSaudi
Reviews.Content: the AC was terrible as it was not working the room was very hot

Reviews.Title: “TimetTurkeys”
Reviews.Author: TimetTurkeys
Reviews.Content: We went to Istanbul with family to celebrate a special birthday. The hotel was situated in a wonderful position within easy walking distance to all of the major attractions. We found the staff friendly and very helpful. The hotel was very clean and tastefully decorated. Breakfast is very good, with a variety of food to suit every taste. We would definitely recommend to others and will hopefully get the chance to re-visit. Overall we had a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable!!”
Reviews.Author: shona63
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed at The Romance for 7 nights in early October 08. It was a tough choice but the various Trip Advisor reviews did not let us down!! The Romance is perfectly located for tourists who want to be near the hub of the old, charming part of Istanbul, yet get the flavour of a modern bustling city. Located a 10-minute walk down the road from Sultanahmet, it is easily accessed; in fact the tram stops right outside the door of the hotel!!! Hagia Sophia, Grand Bazaar, the Spice Market are minutes away. We had a double and a tripleâ€¦â€¦the rooms have been obviously recently refurbished; they are well appointed albeit a little small. The linen is excellent; the bathrooms adequately outfitted. The hotelâ€™s restaurant serves only breakfast, a substantial choice of breads, cold-cuts, cereals, fruits, preserves, eggs, hot and cold beverages. The breads are particularly goodâ€¦.they are freshly baked each dayâ€¦.and the feta cheese is fabulous. The Turkish Tea was a hit with my family! However, the choice remains the same every day and monotony sets in beyond Day 3!! There is no option for night dining unless you go to the sister hotel Yasmak Sultanâ€™s rooftop restaurant, The Olive, for fine dining. The street cafÃ© adjacent to the entrance of The Romance serves you beverages and small snacks. The entire street, however, is full of various eating places ranging from snack counters to coffee bars to full-fledged restaurants. A few doors down from The Romance are little multi-purpose stores to get your water and milk and even the odd gift items! For a great shopping experience, step into The Millennium opposite where the bewildering choice of ceramics and carpetswill blow your mind. The brothers running the store are charming and hospitable and by the time they have plied you with Turkish tea, you will feel its money well spent!! All in all a great experience. There is obviously room for improvement but the staff is friendly and goes out of the way to cater to your needs.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location - Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: WoodyChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel and it was just perfect for us - within walking distance of almost everything we wanted to see, and so convenient that we could even go back to the hotel in the middle of the day if we needed to. The staff was very friendly and went out of their way to be accomodating! Breakfast was delicious and hearty, with excellent service. Our room was comfortable, clean and had a big, lovely balcony. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Experience Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: towergate
Reviews.Content: I visited Istanbul with family to celebrate my 40th Birthday and stayed at the Romance Hotel which is superbly situated for all sights which are within easy walking distance. The Hotel was clean and the staff very friendly. There was a good aray of food available at the buffet breakfast which is open from 7 - 10 (so you can have a lie in if you like). I would recommend the hotel to any traveller wishing to spend time in Istanbul, there are numerous great restaurants and bars in the surrounding streets. A very enjoyable time was spent in Istanbul and we will certainly be returning there in the future.

Reviews.Title: “HIghly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JohnLakeMacquarie
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Romance Hotel with 2 other couples. The reason we chose the Romance was value for money & location. We were not disappoionted. Not only is it within easy walking distance to the Topkapi palace, Blue Mosque, Grand bazaar, Spice Bazaar & ferry wharf, there is a tram stop not far from the front door so to travel further afield is easy (& cheap). The hotel is located on one of the main roads but it is mainly tram traffic, so I thought added to the ambience of the hotel. We enjoyed sitting with the window open & watching & listening to the locals (the windows were double glazed so we could close the sound off when we wanted to sleep too). The breakfast was a very nice selection of cereals, yougurts, pastries & cold meats. And to make the mornings better the Matre'd was extremely helpful with suggestions for the day. There is no rooftop bar, nor is there a pool, but that all helped keep the tarrif reasonable. We'd all stay again. It was great

Reviews.Title: “nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: mkhan1978
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a magical 10 day holiday in turkey of which 5 days were spent in istanbul/ romance hotel. Let me highlight the good things first. Location is gr8, Staff are friendly and helpful. Hotel was clean.Good breakfast. Now the negatives fruniture in rooms need to be refurbished, aircon didnt work properly ( apparently that is the case everywhere in october in turkey as it supposed to be end of summer....... but we had avg 25-30 centigrade temp). Roof top is empty and the nice pictures of open air resturant e.t.c doesnt exist now. Now comes the reason why i am giving this hotel a neutral rating. When i reached the hotel at 21:00 i was told that my room/floor is undergoing repair work so will have to stay in ther sister hotel for 2 nights ( there are 3 hotels owned by same group) so was given a room in 3 star cramped room half the price to what i had paid.( they could have upgraded me to there upscale hotel to compensate for there mistake...... but ofcourse that cant happen).After 2 nights i was moved to romance hotel ( i think they had overbooked the rooms and didnt bother telling me in advance.there was no sign of repair work and i confirmed with people staying in romance hotel that they had not seen or heared any repair going on....naughty) After my complaint they offered me and my wife free turkish bath.....which was awsome by the way but it does leave a foul taste in ones mouth.....because holidays are meant to be hassle free.... I wont stay in romance hotel again... there are many hotels in the same area with good accessability and offer similar rooms, comfort e.t.c.so might as well try someone else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Too good to be true --Romance Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: phebslike
Reviews.Content: Romance Hotel is an awesome hotel. I did not know what to expect and I am glad to say that I was not disappointed. The staff was AMAZING!! Overly friendly, willing to entertain you, made you feel right @ home in a foreign land!!! The location was great!! Its right next door to all the tourist attraction including the blue mosque, saint Sophia, Topkapi palace, the spice market, Grand bazzar etc. Its a charming hotel, but it needs a couple furniture upgrade (going by American standard), but its so clean and charming, that you would barely notice. T'hats all folks!!!

Reviews.Title: “Romance was romantic”
Reviews.Author: IsmailGloucester
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel initially after looking through the reviews of other travellers who had stayed at the hotel. We booked two double rooms for six of us, that is two adults and four children. We wanted three beds, in each room but could not get the rooms with 3 beds whilst booking on line. At about 4.30pm we arrived at the hotel from the airport and the receptionist Ramazan greeted us with welcome Mr Ginwalla and that made it so personal. He had not even looked at any of our paperwork, it was all there on the computer. We were shown to our rooms and they provided us with three beds in each room and one room even had a large balcony. The rooms were very good size. This meant they had taken into consideration our family size and upgraded us without extra cost! The service was excellent and all historic sites within walking distance, the staff very pleasant and attentive and the breakfast in the morning each day was very well laid out and plenty of choice. Our children who are aged 17, 15, 9 and 7 enjoyed the whole expereince and said how much they liked staying at the Romance. For visitors staying at the Romance, I would recommend that they use tours provided by others and not use the hotel, as it will be expensive. There are plenty of people at the historic sites who will show you around for a very cheap price but do remember to haggle. The road that Romance is located has a very good supermarket and you could get your water, and other essentials at a very cheap price from there. There is also an internet cafe just down the road heading towards Eminouno at a place called the point, and you can get an hours internet for just 2 turkisk lira. The hotels internet is very expensive. Overall I would recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: nboogie
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Romance Hotel in June and had an wonderful time - the rooms were small, but clean and comfortable. The hotel breakfast is nice w/all the basics you can ask for (cereal, toast, eggs, coffee, oj, etc) and the staff at the hotel are really friendly and helpful. There was some construction going on outside of our room, but since we were out most of the day it didn't really bother us. The location is perfect - a very short walk to Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, all the bazaars and the ferry dock and about a 12-15 lira cab ride to Taksim Square. All in all, we were quite happy with this hotel and would definitely recommend it to anyone looking for a mid-range hotel w/i walking distance of all the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great Find in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: halatsurmer
Reviews.Content: We were confident in our stay at Romance prior to arrival but we had certain doubts based on the couple negative comments buried amongst the positive reviews on this site. We are writing to confirm the positive reviews and dispel the negative ones. Romance is a GREAT hotel -between budget and mid-range- in Istanbul. We stayed at Romance a total of six nights from Saturday June 28, 2008 until Friday July 4, 2008. We had a double room on the 3d floor facing the back. The room was simple normal size for a similar type hotel, extremely clean with a tv, full bathroom and good size closet. There was construction across the street but thanks to the double pane windows (or other miraculously effective sound insulation) we did not hear a thing and slept in till 10:30 most days. Breakfast is served till 10 and we had it a couple days. It is a great spread and very attentive service. Besides the comfortable room, great sleep and informed concierge service by Sinan the Great, I highly recommend Romance for its location. On the tram line in Sultanahmet, it is perfectly located for a full exploration of Istanbul. Alot of hotels listed on hotels. com are behind the blue mosque in an area only developed around tourism. Romance on the other hand is in a real part of town where you have many tourists but alot of Istanbullus. Romance is still a short walk away from the Ayasofia, Topkapi Palace and the Blue Mosque but is also a short walk from Eminonu, the gateway to Taksim, the Asian shore and the Bosphorous villages. There is a market next door with all sorts of essentials. On the walk from Romance to Eminonu there is also a bank and a pharmacy. Most important though is a great backlava shop on the north side of the street! Rooftop bars are an essential part of any experience in Istanbul and while Romance does not have one, the staff is quick to direct guests to the bar of its sister hotel, 10 meters away, the Olive bar. With breathtaking views of the Ayasofia, the Olive bar lured us nighlty for a pre-dinner drink. Finally there is a beanie Nargileh bar on the pedestrian cobblestone street behind the hotel. We spent two nights there snuggling, drinking raki and meeting other tourists. Overall, I highly recommend Romance to avid travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located Romance - don't let the name put you off”
Reviews.Author: DerrickMyra
Reviews.Content: Perfectly located and very nice hotel in the old part of the city, near to all main tourist sites, the grand Bazaar and the Bosphorus, all of which can be reached on foot. The hotel appeared to have recently been rennovated as it was modern and all facilities were great. The 3 bedded room we had (we were 3 adults) was the most roomy of our whole trip. Possibly a little expensive but the location made it worth it. Service was excellent and break fast good as well. Their website is a good representation of what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debskio
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a City break to Istanbul. I went with my mother and we stayed at the Romance Hotel in Istanbul. The hotel is highly recommended: it is central to all the main attractions, is clean, friendly and the breakfast is great. I really enjoyed my stay here. In particular, I was impressed with the friendly and very helpful nature of all the staff at the hotel - it was always service with a smile. Debbie. Brighton.

Reviews.Title: “Turkish Delight”
Reviews.Author: Jimi_2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a week in Istanbul, staying at the Romance Hotel in one of their suites. The hotel is situated in the heart of the city and all of the top places to visit in the old town are within walking distance. It is also right on the tram line that links all of the disctricts of Istanbul, with a tram stop 50 metres away. We walked to Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya, the Spice Bazaar and to the port of Eminonu where we boarded a ferry for a trip up the Bosphorous. The hotel is a 'boutique' hotel, which means it has a smaller number of rooms (63 in fact) and it has a seating area outside with large Turkish cushions where you can sit and enjoy a drink while you watch an amazing world go by. The hotel staff are all very friendly and extremely helpful, Sinan on reception guided us through some minefields regarding shipping a Turkish carpet home. The shopping in the area is fantastic, the places to eat are numerous and interesting and the weather was just right for us to visit the mosques, museums and other attractions. Special mention goes to the sister hotel next door - the Hotel Yasmak Sultan, which has a brilliant roof-top restaurant, the Olive Restaurant, with views over half of Istanbul. We got talking to Levert there and he organised a specially baked Sea Bass which was really delicious and the evening was a story in itself. A very good holiday and would recommend the Romance Hotel and surrounding area for people who are bored with sitting round the pool all day.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Choice!!!”
Reviews.Author: Candex
Reviews.Content: Hi! IÂ´m Candela from ARGENTINA. I stayed at the hotel with my sister last may and it was great!! The location couldnÂ´t be better!! ItÂ´s near EVERYTHING!!! The hotel is clean, good breakfast... and the best of all... the crew!!! Specially Ramazza (alias RAMON!!) and Ali... both are great!!! TheyÂ´re very helpfull and they speak perfect English!! Ramazza also speaks Spanish!! We really enjoyed our stay there! I recommend it for all kinds of tourists... families with children, young couples, friends... ALL! LA PASAMOS ESPECTACULAR!!! GRACIAS POR TODO RAMON Y ALI!!!! BESOS DESDE ARGENTINA!!!!! CANDELA

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: kiarak75
Reviews.Content: I've just got back from a weekend at the Romance Hotel. I had decided to stay here based on other reviews on Tripadvisor and I must say I made the right choice. The hotel is in a great location, 5 mins walk from Topkapi Palace and Haghia Sophia, 10 mins walk from the Blue Mosque and maybe 10-15 to the port to take the Bosphorus Cruise. The hotel is a nice property on 5 floors with lift. Rooms are clean but not big. Considering that we didn't plan to stay in our room all the time it wasn't a problem. There are a minibar and also a safe in the rooms (safe free of charge). Sheets and towels are clean, only thing I didn't like was the carpet, a bit old/dirty looking (I'm allergic to dust, so hate carpets in general, unless brand new!)The bathroom has bathtub with shower and hairdryer and it was spotless clean. The hotel is on a small street where the tram passes, but since the tram is quite modern I didn't experience noise at night, the windows are fairly new and isolate from the outside noise quite well. Breakfast was just ok, it looks like croissants are not very popular in Istanbul (couldn't even find them at the airport!) but there was a good choice of bread, cake, jam (even a type of jam for diabetic people), eggs, cheese, olives. There is a restaurant but we never tried it, as there are many restaurants as soon as you walk out of the hotel. Outside the hotel there are plenty of souvenir shops, restaurants, and also a pharmacy. The hallways in the hotel were smelling a bit of smoke (like most places in Istanbul) which may be annoying for non-smokers. Also, most small restaurants in Istanbul don't have a non-smoking area so keep that in mind and choose outside seating areas, or you will cough throughout dinner! Overall we had a very enjoyable stay at this hotel, the location is perfect and the staff is very friendly and they speak good english. Piece of advise when travelling back from Istanbul: on the way back we had to queue for almost 2 hours at the airport: as soon as you get to the airport you have to go through security: 6am and it was absolutely packed! You have to screen everything before you got to your check-in counter. Once you pass the security check you go to the check in counter and realize that the Turkish Airline flight to London has only 1 counter opened for about 200 people! Another queue. Once you check in you go through passport control. One more queue. You think you are done? Nope! To go to your gate you have to pass another screening and this time taking also your shoes off (why not doing it at the beginning???). Fourth queue. After that you just have one more passport control (fifth queue) before you can finally reach the gate and have your boarding pass checked before flying home! Unbelievable!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Romance Hotel, Best rate for your money! great location!”
Reviews.Author: PickyUsa
Reviews.Content: We loved the romance hotel! the staff are so friendly and incredibly helfpful! the rate is a good rate! the location is perfect! you can walk to all tourist sites and the port to take the boat to the bosphours! if you book on their website, they will give you a free shuttle ride from the airport to the hotel. the hotel looks just like the pictures on the website. the breakfast is decent. the staff speaks good english. clean and semi modern. comparable to a courtyard or a 3 star hotel in the US. i highly recommend this hotel for travellers on a budget but cant stay in crappy places!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: BrunoJackson
Reviews.Content: Short walk to all the major sites (amazing!) and tram stop a few metres from the hotel for quick access to the rest of the city, and to the airport. Staff all very friendly and helpful. We arrived at 9:30 a.m. but no problem with checking in straight away. Good selection for breakfast. Didn't eat here in the evenings, or use the bar, because there are plenty of other options available close by. Only criticism is that rooms are quite small. Not a problem for us but I can imagine that larger or less agile people might complain! Overall: excellent value for money and a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: a_andermatt
Reviews.Content: We had a twin room on the 1st floor for 5 nights. The room was clean and localized at the silent back side of the building. Staff was friendly and helpful. Location is quite close to main attractions as Blue Mosque, Hagia Sophia (about 10 minutes walking) etc. To sum up, we're very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: Lossey
Reviews.Content: We have just recently returned from the Romance hotel in Istanbul, and we couldn't of asked for better service... the staff there are always willing to help with any problem you may have... We had originally booked to attend a football match, but extended it to see the sites... but we hadn't a clue on how to get to the match.... a member of staff called Sinan was brilliant... without him we just wouldn't of got there or back.... as it was about a hour away. As for other members of staff they too were as helpful, always greeted us with a warm smile and a chat. The hotel itself was clean, and the bedroom and bathroom as cleaned each day with new linen and towels, and the rooms were not that small, plenty of space to move about. Breakfasts are not your traditional full English, so if your exepecting this then you will be disappointed, but they do put on a "full" breakfast, cheeses, cold and hot meats, cereal, yogurts loads of bread and cups of tea!! etc you certainly won't go hungry. Location was brilliant we manage to walk to many of the famous buildings around there and shops etc... once again if you had a problem always ask the staff... who were more than willing to help! If I was to go back I would certainly use this hotel and would recommend this to anyone! brilliant!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and very friendly”
Reviews.Author: BuckinghamshireWill
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Hotel Romance by Cities Direct when we paid a short visit to Istanbul. We found everyone to be very helpful and friendly giving great advice on trips and how to get the best from Istanbuls fantastic and cheap transport system. The rooms were spotless and comfortable with great ensuite facilities. Dispite being budget, the buffet breakfasts were good with plenty of choice. The location is perfect for exploring the wonderful sights that Istanbul has to offer in the Old Town, including the Topkaki Palace and the Blue Mosque.Resuarants a plenty just around the corner and a tram stop a few metres away that will whisk you across the Bospherous and the Asian part of Istanbul in minutes all make the Hotel Romance, despite its dubious sounding name a great choice. Don't be concerned about booking direct, as they speak most languages and could'nt be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Central located with very good service”
Reviews.Author: Ferietur
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel located in the most interesting part of Istanbul. You could easily walk to all the main attractions. The hotel was clean and nice decorated. The staff was most helpful and gave many good advices. No matter what your question was - No problem!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Niela
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 10 day trip to Istanbul. Romance hotel offers an excellent service and location for the price and is the place we will sure return to next time we are at Istanbul. We enjoyed the daily breakfast which caters to a wide variety of taste and health restrictions. The hotel staff is extremely polite and knowledgeable. They speak several different languages and will go out of their way to arrange for your daily excursions or get the address for your favorite Jazz club. You will certainly get a lot for your money when you stay at the Romance Hotel. We recommend it enthusiastically.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at reasonable prices + great location”
Reviews.Author: FP67
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel in the middle of Istanbul, walking distance (5 minutes) of the Hagia Sofia and the Blue Mosque. Staff is very friendly and professional, rooms are very clean and service is with a smile. We did not try the sauna/gym as we were very busy exploring Istanbul, but we have no doubt that this will also live up to the quality we have come to expect here. Staff are very helpful and will ensure that you will get best value for money

Reviews.Title: “Romance Hotel is Romantic!”
Reviews.Author: Heggiecm
Reviews.Content: Perfect location within Sultanahmet, close to all main attractions ie Aya Sophia, Blue Mosque, Basilica Cistern, Grand Bazaar and the Egyptian Spice Market. Hotel itself is a little dated, but very nice & functional. Good rooms - request the suite if possible.

Reviews.Title: “Everything was perfect”
Reviews.Author: SanjaCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: We booked at the hotel's website, and therefore got free airport pickup wich was more than perfect. A very nice chauffeur awaited us with a namesign, and drowe us to the hotel (traffic in Istanbul is not for nervous people!). Our bags were taken to our room by a bell-boy, and since we were on our honeymoon, the hotel had placed us a very nice room with a balcony and free wine and fruit basket. The room was small, but clean and nicely decorated and the bed was large though not very soft.
