Breakfast was more than fine, a large selection of bread, cakes, cerials, cheese, olives, youghurt etc. Fresh orangejuice could be bought for 5 ytl, but we didn't try it. Location of hotel was perfect. No problems with noise, but right on the street leading to Aya Sofia, Topkapi and Blue Mosque. Quite a few shops on the street towards the harbour, where you can find better prices than in the Grand Bazar, if you are not the most experienced haggler. I can reccomend "Ida gift shop", wich is on the opposite side of the street from the hotel. When checking out, the staff were very helpfull with getting a taxi to the airport, and with storing our bags untill we had to leave for the airport (at 6 p.m.) All in all, this hotel was perfect for our honeymoon, and I can only reccomend it for others.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MikeN_GR
Reviews.Content: I staid at the hotel for 5 nights. The hotel is in an excellent location at the old town near to all the attractions. The hotel is a good value for money choice! The staff was very friendly and helpful in everything. Breakfast was very good with a good variety. I would recommend this hotel definitely!!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in good location.”
Reviews.Author: MJHoneymoon
Reviews.Content: Romance Hotel is in a great location in the centre of old Istanbul. It is located near a tram stop and within walking distance of shopping, touristy restaurants and Topkapi Palace. It is a longer walk or short tram ride to Sultanahmet, Spices Bazaar, Grand Bazaar and Blue Mosque. We booked a junior suite which was great as it had a small lounge room seperate from the bedroom. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast had a big range of food with lots and lots of bread and buffet of some hot dishes, cheese, olives, cold meats etc. A good value hotel in a good location.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: evmaya
Reviews.Content: great little simple hotel in the best location in istanbul. Totally quiet, great receprtion..porters awaiting your arrival, tiny rooms but clean...pay a little more and get a larger room with a small lounge of the bedroom, well worthwhile...nice simple breakfast. Overall and excellent 3 star hotel with great cheap prices on various websites...highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Feel the Romance at the Romance Hotel....”
Reviews.Author: kaankoc
Reviews.Content: A few years ago i stayed in Romance Hotel with my friend from Japan.The staffs were extremely friendly and helpful.If you want to feel Romance,Come to Romance Hotel..We really feel romance at this hotel.Thank you Romance...Thank you Romance Hotel.. Suleyman Kocdan-Turkey

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: Solihull
Reviews.Content: The Romance hotel is a gem of a place and outstanding value for money. The staff are friendly and attentive and the rooms are cosy and clean. For Â£22 per person per night including breakfast, is this the bargain of the year? The greatest thing about the Romance is its position. It is within walking distance of the major tourist attractions of this amazing city. If you have any doubts about Istanbul as a tourist detsination. Forget them! Istanbul is superb!!

Reviews.Title: “Our stay in Hotel Romance, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: Nyah4
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely time in Hotel Romance in Istanbul.from 13 th of april till the 18th of april 2007 The room was nice, breakfast good,and the staff very friendly and helpfull. And the weather was just good to do a lot of things. A boat tour to the Princess Islands fantastic, the island BÃ¼yÃ¼kada, making a coachtour 0f 45 minutes over the island is just fun. We can recommand The Romance Hotel to tourists who intend to come to this Hotel. And Istanbul is great to visit. We certainly will come back for another stay. Elly and Joyce from The netherlands. Gel , ne dursan ol, yine gel...... Come who ever you are, just come, by; mevlana CelÃ¢leddÃ®n-i RÃ»mÃ®.

Reviews.Title: “Great! Nice room, good breakfast, excellent position!”
Reviews.Author: Silverino
Reviews.Content: I spent five nights in a twin room at the Romance Hotel. The Hotel is modern and very nice, the overall impression is very good. Its position is excellent: just three minutes walk to Hagia Sofia, Blue Mosque and Topkapi palace. Just few metres from the building there is a tramway stop: you can easily reach Grand Bazaar (three stops), the Sirkeci Train Station (one stop) and the port (two stops) to start a cruise on the Bosporus. The room was a twin room, even if I booked a single. It was not big but not small as pointed out by some other reviewers. The bathroom was very clean and had everything from soap to toothbrush, from cotton ear buds to air-dryer. A small TV set with satellite channels (channels from UK, France, Italy and Germany... ), a minibar (sodas, chocolate and snacks) and a safe were available in the room. Breakfast was pretty good: excellent selection of bread and brioches, cereals, cheese (feta cheese and sheep cheese), dried fruits, juice, Ã§ay Turkish tea and coffee. A freshly squeezed orange juice is available too and it's charged five lira (but remember that bottled orange juice is available too and it is for free). Staff is friendly, discrete and helpful when needed. I will come back to this hotel, should I visit Istanbul once again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect situation, with tram transport just a few steps away”
Reviews.Author: lynanne
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a 7 night stay at Hotel Romance and while our room was tiny, everything else was just right. The staff were very helpful and spoke good english and our buffet breakfast was a delight. Everything was freshly made and presented and the assortment of bread was excellent. All the historical sites are a short walk away and if one wanted to go further afield, the tram was just outside.

Reviews.Title: “There are better alternatives for the same price”
Reviews.Author: Clarky_1970
Reviews.Content: I was three days in this Hotel. I decided to stay there, because of the many good comments about it, but now i cannot understand why the people think, this hotel is so fantastic. I find it just an average hotel. Positiv: The location is very good. The personal is very very friendly. Rooms are clean. Negativ: Food (i know just the breakfast buffet) ist under every niveau, it's horrible!. The Rooms are very small. I think, for the same price you can find somthing better.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel, 2* at a push”
Reviews.Author: markyd72
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel through easyjet website and should have realised that it was pretty cheap for a 4* hotel. The room was very very small and the furnishings were old and worn. The breakfast was very poor as well, a few boiled eggs, stale cereal and warm UHT milk. Orange juice was not included with the breakfast but a small glass could be purchased at an extortionate rate. An evening meal in the restaurant was just as bad as the breakfast with cold small portions - all very disappointing considering that we had great food in the rest of Istanbul. It seemed that the hotel only managed to survive due to cruise ship bookings, with the majority of the guests staying for no longer than a night whilst their cruise ship was docked. The hotel is cheap but don't expect 4* and don't eat there.

Reviews.Title: “We will never come back”
Reviews.Author: whesther
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because all the critics we read on this page were excellent. I must say that I differ from all these opinios. It was our Honeymoon and we couldn't have chosen a worse hotel. The rooms were vey small (we had to jump over the suitcases to go from bed to the toilet) but at least everything was more or less clean (except the carpet). But the problem is not the room, it is the staff. We had all our meals included, but twice we tried to have dinner there we had some problems since I don't know why, they raised some objections to serve us. They even argued among them before serving us.. The food at the hotel is not good, I recommend to go to any restaurants nearby that are much better. When we came back from Capadocia they were supposed to have two rooms for us and another couple, but they didn't, they sent the other couple to another hotel. This other couple had also some complains about the hotel, but I'm not talking about this because it didn't happend to me.

HotelInfo.Name: Romance Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hudavendigar Caddesi No:7 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34410, Turkey
